&lt;p style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&lt;b&gt;&lt;i&gt;Legal&#13;Structure and Nature of Operations&lt;/i&gt;&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;New Age&#13;Beverages Corporation (the &amp;#8220;Company&amp;#8221;) was formed under the laws of the State of Washington on April 26, 2010&#13;under the name American Brewing Company, Inc. In April 2015, the Company acquired the assets of B&amp;#38;R Liquid Adventure (&amp;#8220;B&amp;#38;R&amp;#8221;),&#13;which included the brand B&amp;#250;cha&amp;#174; Live Kombucha. In June 2016, the Company acquired the combined assets of Xing&#13;Beverage, LLC, Aspen Pure&amp;#174;, LLC, New Age Beverages, LLC, and New Age Properties, LLC and changed the Company&amp;#8217;s&#13;name to New Age Beverages Corporation.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;In&#13;March 2017, the Company entered into a business combination with Maverick Brands, LLC (&amp;#8220;Maverick&amp;#8221;), including acquisition&#13;of the Coco-Libre brand. In May 2017, the Company entered into a business combination with PMC Holdings, Inc. (&amp;#8220;PMC&amp;#8221;),&#13;and in June 2017, the Company completed a business combination with Marley Beverage Company, LLC (&amp;#8220;Marley&amp;#8221;) including&#13;the worldwide brand licensing rights to all Marley brand non-alcoholic ready-to-drink (&amp;#8220;RTD&amp;#8221;) beverages. On December&#13;21, 2018, the Company completed a business combination with Morinda Holdings, Inc., a Utah corporation (&amp;#8220;Morinda&amp;#8221;),&#13;whereby&amp;#160;Morinda became a wholly-owned subsidiary of the Company. For further information about the Company&amp;#8217;s acquisitions&#13;in 2017 and 2018, please refer to Note 3.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;The&#13;Company manufactures, markets and sells a portfolio of healthy beverage brands including XingTea, Marley, Aspen Pure&amp;#174;, B&amp;#250;cha&amp;#174;&#13;Live Kombucha, and Coco-Libre. The portfolio is distributed through the Company&amp;#8217;s own Direct Store Distribution (&amp;#8220;DSD&amp;#8221;)&#13;network and a hybrid of other routes to market throughout the United States and in 15 countries around the world. The brands are&#13;sold in all channels of distribution including Hypermarkets, Supermarkets, Pharmacies, Convenience, Gas and other outlets.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;Morinda&#13;is primarily engaged in the development, manufacturing, and marketing of Tahitian Noni&amp;#174; Juice, MAX and other noni beverages&#13;(Morinda&amp;#8217;s primary products) as well as other nutritional, cosmetic and personal care products. The majority of Morinda&amp;#8217;s&#13;products have a component of the Noni plant, Morinda Citrifolia (&amp;#8220;Noni&amp;#8221;) as a common element. Morinda primarily sells&#13;and distributes its products to independent product distributors through a direct to consumer selling network. Morinda is based&#13;in the United States and markets and sells its products in more than 60&amp;#160;countries throughout the world.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;The&#13;Company and its subsidiaries are subject to regulation from a number of governmental agencies, including the U.S.&amp;#160;Food and&#13;Drug Administration; Federal Trade Commission; Consumer Product Safety Commission; federal, state, and local taxing agencies;&#13;and others. In addition, the Company and its subsidiaries are subject to regulations from a number of foreign government agencies.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&lt;b&gt;&lt;i&gt;Basis&#13;of Presentation and Consolidation&lt;/i&gt;&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;The&#13;Company has four wholly-owned subsidiaries, NABC, Inc., NABC Properties, LLC (&amp;#8220;NABC Properties&amp;#8221;), New Age Health Sciences&#13;Holdings, Inc., and Morinda. NABC, Inc. is a Colorado-based operating company that consolidates performance and financial results&#13;of the Company&amp;#8217;s subsidiaries and divisions. NABC Properties manages leasing and ownership issues for the Company&amp;#8217;s&#13;buildings and warehouses (except for those owned or leased by Morinda), and New Age Health Sciences owns the Company&amp;#8217;s intellectual&#13;property, and manages operating performance in the medical and hospital channels. Due to the recent acquisition of Morinda, there&#13;have been no material changes to the operations of that subsidiary.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;The&#13;consolidated financial statements, which include the accounts of the Company and its four wholly-owned subsidiaries, are prepared&#13;in conformity with generally accepted accounting principles in the United States of America (&amp;#8220;U.S. GAAP&amp;#8221;). All significant&#13;intercompany balances and transactions have been eliminated.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&lt;b&gt;&lt;i&gt;Emerging&#13;Growth Company&lt;/i&gt;&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;The&#13;accompanying audited consolidated financial statements and related footnotes have been prepared in accordance with applicable&#13;rules and regulations of the Securities and Exchange Commission (&amp;#8220;SEC&amp;#8221;).&lt;b&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/b&gt;The Company is an &amp;#8220;emerging&#13;growth company,&amp;#8221; as defined in Section 2(a) of the Securities Act, as modified by the Jumpstart Our Business Startups Act&#13;of 2012 (the &amp;#8220;JOBS Act&amp;#8221;), and it may take advantage of certain exemptions from various reporting requirements that&#13;are applicable to other public companies that are not emerging growth companies including, but not limited to, not being required&#13;to comply with the auditor attestation requirements of Section 404 of the Sarbanes-Oxley Act of 2002 (the &amp;#8220;Sarbanes-Oxley&#13;Act&amp;#8221;), reduced disclosure obligations regarding executive compensation, and exemptions from the requirements of holding&#13;a nonbinding advisory vote on executive compensation and shareholder approval of any golden parachute payments not previously&#13;approved.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;Further,&#13;Section 102(b)(1) of the JOBS Act exempts emerging growth companies from being required to comply with new or revised financial&#13;accounting standards until private companies (that is, those that have not had a Securities Act registration statement declared&#13;effective or do not have a class of securities registered under the Securities Exchange Act of 1934, as amended (the &amp;#8220;Exchange&#13;Act&amp;#8221;)) are required to comply with the new or revised financial accounting standards. The JOBS Act provides that a company&#13;can elect to opt out of the extended transition period and comply with the requirements that apply to non-emerging growth companies&#13;but any such election to opt out is irrevocable. The Company previously elected to opt out of such extended transition period&#13;which means that the Company must adopt new or revised accounting standards at the same time public companies are required to&#13;adopt the new or revised standard. The Company currently expects to retain its status as an emerging growth company until the&#13;year ending December 31, 2021, but this status could end sooner under certain circumstances.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&lt;b&gt;&lt;i&gt;Reclassifications&lt;/i&gt;&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;Certain&#13;amounts in the 2017 financial statements have been reclassified to conform to the current period financial statement presentation.&#13;These reclassifications had no effect on the previously reported net loss, working capital, cash flows and stockholders&amp;#8217;&#13;equity.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
&lt;p style=margin: 0pt; font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&lt;b&gt;&lt;i&gt;Use&#13;of Estimates&lt;/i&gt;&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;The&#13;preparation of financial statements and related disclosures in conformity with U.S. GAAP requires the Company to make judgments,&#13;assumptions, and estimates that affect the amounts reported in its consolidated financial statements and accompanying notes. The&#13;Company bases its estimates and assumptions on current facts, historical experience, and various other factors that it believes&#13;are reasonable under the circumstances, to determine the carrying values of assets and liabilities that are not readily apparent&#13;from other sources. The Company&amp;#8217;s significant accounting estimates include, but are not necessarily limited to, estimated&#13;useful lives for identifiable intangible assets and property and equipment, impairment of goodwill and long-lived assets, valuation&#13;assumptions for stock options, warrants and equity instruments issued for goods or services, the allowance for doubtful accounts&#13;receivable, inventory obsolescence, the allowance for sales returns and chargebacks, deferred income taxes and the related valuation&#13;allowances, and the evaluation and measurement of contingencies. To the extent there are material differences between the Company&amp;#8217;s&#13;estimates and the actual results, the Company&amp;#8217;s future consolidated results of operation will be affected.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&lt;b&gt;&lt;i&gt;Risks&#13;and Uncertainties&lt;/i&gt;&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;Inherent&#13;in the Company&amp;#8217;s business are various risks and uncertainties, including its limited operating history in a rapidly changing&#13;industry. These risks include the Company&amp;#8217;s ability to manage its rapid growth and its ability to attract new customers&#13;and expand sales to existing customers, risks related to litigation, as well as other risks and uncertainties. In the event that&#13;the Company does not successfully execute its business plan, certain assets may not be recoverable, certain liabilities may not&#13;be paid and investments in its capital stock may not be recoverable. The Company&amp;#8217;s success depends upon the acceptance of&#13;its expertise in providing services, development of sales and distribution channels, and its ability to generate significant net&#13;revenue and cash flows from the use of this expertise.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&lt;b&gt;&lt;i&gt;Segments&lt;/i&gt;&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;The&#13;Company&amp;#8217;s chief operating decision maker (the &amp;#8220;CODM&amp;#8221;), who is the Company&amp;#8217;s Chief Executive Officer,&#13;allocates resources and assesses performance based on financial information of the Company. The CODM reviews financial&#13;information presented for  each reporting segments for purposes of making operating decisions and assessing financial&#13;performance. Accordingly, the Company operates in two reportable segments as presented in Note 15.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&lt;b&gt;&lt;i&gt;Cash&#13;and Cash Equivalents&lt;/i&gt;&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;All&#13;highly liquid investments purchased with an original maturity of three months or less that are freely available for the Company&amp;#8217;s&#13;immediate and general business use are classified as cash and cash equivalents. Cash and cash equivalents consist primarily of&#13;demand deposits with financial institutions.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&lt;b&gt;&lt;i&gt;Allowance&#13;for Doubtful Accounts&lt;/i&gt;&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;The&#13;Company records a provision for doubtful accounts based on historical experience and a detailed assessment of the collectability&#13;of its accounts receivable. In estimating the allowance for doubtful accounts, the Company considers, among other factors, the&#13;aging of the accounts receivable, its historical write-offs, the credit worthiness of customers, and general economic conditions.&#13;Account balances are charged against the allowance when the Company believes that it is probable that the receivable will not&#13;be recovered. Actual write-offs may either be in excess or less than the estimated allowance. Recoveries of any accounts receivable&#13;previously written off are recorded as a reduction of expense when received.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&lt;b&gt;&lt;i&gt;Inventories&lt;/i&gt;&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;Inventories&#13;consist of the costs associated with the purchase of raw materials and the manufacturing and transportation of products. Inventories&#13;are stated at the lower of cost or net realizable value using the first-in, first-out method. Provisions for excess inventory&#13;are included in cost of goods sold and have historically been immaterial.&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&lt;b&gt;&lt;i&gt;Property&#13;and Equipment&lt;/i&gt;&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;Property&#13;and equipment are recorded at cost less accumulated depreciation and amortization. Depreciation is calculated using the straight-line&#13;method over the estimated useful lives of the assets, as follows:&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;table cellspacing=0 cellpadding=0 style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; width: 100%&gt;&#13;&lt;tr style=vertical-align: bottom; font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=width: 87%; font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=width: 13%; border-bottom: black 1pt solid; font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; text-align: center&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&lt;b&gt;Years&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&#13;&lt;tr style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;Buildings&#13;    and improvements&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=vertical-align: bottom; text-align: center; font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;28-40&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&#13;&lt;tr style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;Machinery&#13;    and equipment&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=vertical-align: bottom; text-align: center; font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;3-7&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&#13;&lt;tr style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;Office&#13;    furniture and equipment&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=vertical-align: bottom; text-align: center; font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;3-10&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&#13;&lt;tr style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;Delivery&#13;    vehicles&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=vertical-align: bottom; text-align: center; font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;3-5&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&#13;&lt;/table&gt;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;Leasehold&#13;improvements are amortized over the remaining lease term or the estimated useful life of the asset, whichever is shorter. As of&#13;December 31, 2018, leasehold improvements are being amortized over lives ranging from 1 to 10 years. Maintenance and repairs are&#13;expensed as incurred. Depreciation commences when assets are initially placed into service for their intended use.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&lt;b&gt;&lt;i&gt;Goodwill&#13;and&amp;#160;Intangible Assets&lt;/i&gt;&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;Goodwill&#13;represents the excess of the purchase price of acquired businesses over the estimated fair value of the identifiable net assets&#13;acquired. Goodwill and other intangibles with indefinite useful lives are not amortized but tested for impairment annually or&#13;more frequently when events or circumstances indicates that the carrying value of a reporting unit more likely than not exceeds&#13;its fair value. The goodwill impairment test is applied by performing a qualitative assessment before calculating the fair value&#13;of the reporting unit. If, on the basis of qualitative factors, it is considered more likely than not that the fair value of the&#13;reporting unit is greater than the carrying amount, further testing of goodwill for impairment is not required. If the carrying&#13;amount of a reporting unit exceeds the reporting unit&amp;#8217;s fair value, an impairment loss is recognized in an amount equal&#13;to that excess, limited to the total amount of goodwill allocated to that reporting unit. The Company performed a qualitative&#13;assessment and determined there was no impairment of goodwill for the years ended December 31, 2018 and 2017.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;Intangible&#13;assets acquired in business combinations are recorded at the estimated acquisition date fair value. Finite lived intangible assets&#13;are amortized over the shorter of the contractual life or their estimated useful life using the straight-line method, which is&#13;determined by identifying the period over which the cash flows from the asset are expected to be generated.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;In&#13;connection with the Company&amp;#8217;s business combinations, identifiable intangible assets were acquired that were recorded at&#13;estimated fair value on the date of acquisition. These assets are being amortized using the straight-line method over the amortization&#13;periods shown below:&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;table cellspacing=0 cellpadding=0 style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; width: 100%&gt;&#13;&lt;tr style=vertical-align: bottom; font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times

 Times

 Serif&gt;Independent&#13;    product consultants distribution network&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
