 Times
 Serif&gt;Non-compete&#13;    agreements&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=text-align: right; font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;3&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=text-align: right; font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;3.0&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&#13;&lt;/table&gt;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;_________________&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;table cellpadding=0 style=width: 100%; font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&#13;&lt;tr style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=vertical-align: top; width: 48px; padding-left: 0.25in; font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;(1)&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=padding: 0.75pt; text-align: justify; font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;In&#13;    order to more closely reflect the estimated economic life of the license agreement acquired in the June 2017 acquisition of&#13;    Marley, the Company revised the estimated useful life from 42 years to 15 years during the fourth quarter of 2018. The carrying&#13;    value of this license was approximately $5.7 million, and the impact of the change in estimate resulted in an additional $64,000&#13;    of amortization expense for the fourth quarter of 2018&amp;#160;whereby the change to earnings per share was immaterial. For the&#13;    year ending December 31, 2019, total amortization expense related to this license agreement is expected to be approximately&#13;    $0.4 million as compared to approximately $0.2 million that was recognized for the year ended December 31, 2018.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&#13;&lt;/table&gt;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&lt;b&gt;&lt;i&gt;Impairment&#13;of Long-lived Assets&lt;/i&gt;&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;Long-lived&#13;assets are reviewed for impairment whenever events or changes in circumstances indicate the carrying amount of an asset may not&#13;be recoverable. Impairment exists for property and equipment and other long-lived assets if the carrying amounts of such assets&#13;exceed the estimates of future net undiscounted cash flows expected to be generated by such assets. An impairment charge is recognized&#13;for the amount by which the carrying amount of the asset, or asset group, exceeds its fair value. No impairment of long-lived&#13;assets occurred in the years presented.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&lt;b&gt;&lt;i&gt;Leases&lt;/i&gt;&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;The&#13;Company determines if contractual arrangements are considered a lease at inception. Operating leases are included in operating&#13;lease right-of-use (&amp;#8220;ROU&amp;#8221;) assets, whereas assets related to finance leases are included in property and equipment.&#13;The corresponding liabilities related to ROU assets and assets under financing leases are included in accrued liabilities and&#13;other long-term liabilities in the Company&amp;#8217;s consolidated balance sheets, based on the related contractual maturities. ROU&#13;assets represent the Company&amp;#8217;s right to use an underlying asset for the lease term and lease liabilities represent the related&#13;obligations to make lease payments arising from the lease. Operating lease ROU assets and liabilities are recognized at the lease&#13;commencement date based on the present value of lease payments over the lease term. None of the Company&amp;#8217;s leases provide&#13;an implicit interest rate, which requires use of the Company&amp;#8217;s estimated incremental borrowing rate to determine the present&#13;value of lease payments. The operating lease ROU asset also includes any lease payments made and excludes lease incentives.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;When&#13;lease terms include options to extend or terminate the lease that are reasonably certain to be exercised, the ROU calculations&#13;give effect to such options. Lease expense for lease payments is recognized on a straight-line basis over the lease term. Some&#13;of the Company&amp;#8217;s lease agreements contain lease and non-lease components, which are generally accounted for separately.&#13;However, for certain leases, the Company elects to account for the lease and non-lease components as a single lease component.&#13;Additionally, for certain equipment leases, the Company applies a portfolio approach to effectively account for the operating&#13;lease ROU assets and liabilities.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&lt;b&gt;&lt;i&gt;Debt&#13;Issuance Costs and Discounts&lt;/i&gt;&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;Debt&#13;issuance costs incurred to obtain new debt financing or modify existing debt financing consist of incremental direct costs incurred&#13;for professional fees and due diligence services, including reimbursement of similar costs incurred by the lenders. Amounts paid&#13;to the lenders when a financing is consummated are a reduction of the proceeds and are treated as a debt discount. Except for&#13;revolving lines of credit, debt issuance costs and discounts are presented in the accompanying consolidated balance sheets as&#13;a reduction in the carrying value of the debt and are accreted to interest expense using the effective interest method. Debt issuance&#13;costs related to revolving lines of credit are presented in the accompanying consolidated balance sheets as a long-term asset&#13;and are amortized using the straight-line method over the contractual term of the debt agreement. Unamortized deferred debt issuance&#13;costs are not charged to expense when the related debt becomes a demand obligation due to the violation of terms so long as it&#13;is probable that the lenders will either waive the violation or will agree to amend or restructure the terms of the indebtedness.&#13;If either circumstance is probable, the deferred debt issuance costs continue to be amortized over the remaining term of the initial&#13;amortization period. If it is not probable, the costs will be charged to expense.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&lt;b&gt;&lt;i&gt;Deferred&#13;Offering Costs&lt;/i&gt;&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;Commissions,&#13;legal fees and other costs that are directly associated with equity offerings are capitalized as deferred offering costs, pending&#13;a determination of the success of the offering. Deferred offering costs related to successful offerings are charged to additional&#13;paid-in capital in the period it is determined that the offering was successful. Deferred offering costs related to unsuccessful&#13;equity offerings are recorded as expense in the period when it is determined that an offering is unsuccessful.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&lt;b&gt;&lt;i&gt;Revenue&#13;Recognition&lt;/i&gt;&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&lt;b&gt;&lt;i&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/i&gt;&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&lt;b&gt;&lt;i&gt;&lt;/i&gt;&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 8pt/107% Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0 0 8pt&gt;We recognize revenue when our performance obligations&#13;are satisfied. Our primary performance obligation (the distribution and sale of beverage products) is satisfied upon the shipment&#13;or delivery of products to our customers, which is also when control is transferred. Merchandising activities that are performed&#13;after a customer obtains control of the product, are accounted for as fulfillment of our performance obligation to ship or deliver&#13;product to our customers and are recorded in selling, general and administrative expenses. Merchandising activities are immaterial&#13;in the context of our contracts.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 8pt/107% Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0 0 8pt&gt;The transfer of control of products to our customers is&#13;typically based on written sales terms that do not allow for a right of return. However, our policy for DSD and certain chilled&#13;products is to remove and replace damaged and out-of-date products from store shelves to ensure that consumers receive the product&#13;quality and freshness they expect. Similarly, our policy for certain warehouse-distributed products is to replace damaged and out-of-date&#13;products. As a result, we record reserves, based on estimates, for anticipated damaged and out-of-date products.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&lt;b&gt;&lt;i&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/i&gt;&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/font&gt;Revenue&#13;consists of the gross sales price, less estimated returns and allowances for which provisions are made at the time of sale, and&#13;less certain other discounts, allowances, and personal rebates that are accounted for as a reduction from gross revenue. Shipping&#13;and handling charges that are billed to customers are included as a component of revenue. Costs incurred by the Company for shipping&#13;and handling charges are included in cost of goods sold.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;Payments&#13;received for undelivered or back-ordered products are recorded as deferred revenue. The Company&amp;#8217;s policy is to defer revenue&#13;related to distributor convention fees, payments received on products ordered in the current period but not delivered until the&#13;subsequent period, initial independent product consultants (&amp;#8220;IPCs&amp;#8221;) fees, IPC renewal fees and internet subscription&#13;fees until the products or services have been provided. Deferred revenue is included in accrued liabilities in the accompanying&#13;consolidated balance sheets.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&lt;b&gt;&lt;i&gt;Customer&#13;Programs and Incentives&lt;/i&gt;&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;The&#13;Company incurs customer program costs to promote sales of products and to maintain competitive pricing.&amp;#160; Amounts paid in&#13;connection with customer programs and incentives are recorded as reductions to revenue or as advertising, promotional and selling&#13;expenses, based on the nature of the expenditure. The Company accounts for volume rebates made to its independent product consultants&#13;(&amp;#8220;IPCs&amp;#8221;) and similar discounts and incentives as a reduction of revenue in the accompanying consolidated statements&#13;of operations.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&lt;b&gt;&lt;i&gt;Sales&#13;and Marketing Expenses&lt;/i&gt;&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;Advertising,&#13;promotional and selling expenses consisted of sales salaries, tap handles, media advertising costs, sales and marketing expenses,&#13;and promotional activity expenses and are recognized in the period incurred.&amp;#160;The Company accrues expenses for incentive trips&#13;associated with Morinda&amp;#8217;s direct sales marketing program, which rewards certain IPCs with paid attendance at its conventions,&#13;meetings, and retreats. Expenses associated with incentive trips are accrued over qualification periods as they are earned. The&#13;Company specifically analyzes incentive trip accruals based on historical and current sales trends as well as contractual obligations&#13;when evaluating the adequacy of the incentive trip accrual. Actual results could result in liabilities being more or less than&#13;the amounts recorded.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&lt;b&gt;&lt;i&gt;Research&#13;and Development&lt;/i&gt;&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;Research&#13;and development costs are primarily related to development of new product formulas. All research and development costs are expensed&#13;as incurred. Research and development costs were not material for the years ended December 31, 2018 and 2017&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&lt;b&gt;&lt;i&gt;Stock-Based&#13;Compensation&lt;/i&gt;&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;The&#13;Company measures the cost of employee and director services received in exchange for all equity awards granted, including stock&#13;options, based on the fair market value of the award as of the grant date. The Company computes the fair value of options using&#13;the Black-Scholes-Merton (&amp;#8220;BSM&amp;#8221;) option pricing model. The Company recognizes the cost of the equity awards over the&#13;period that services are provided to earn the award, usually the vesting period. For awards granted which contain a graded vesting&#13;schedule, and the only condition for vesting is a service condition, compensation cost is recognized as an expense on a straight-line&#13;basis over the requisite service period as if the award was, in substance, a single award. The Company recognizes the impact of&#13;forfeitures in the period that the forfeiture occurs, rather than estimating the number of awards that are not expected to vest&#13;in accounting for stock-based compensation.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&lt;b&gt;&lt;i&gt;Derivatives&lt;/i&gt;&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;The&#13;Company holds a derivative financial instrument in the form of an interest rate swap. The Company uses interest rate swaps to&#13;economically convert variable interest rate debt on a foreign mortgage to a fixed rate. The Company has not designated these derivatives&#13;as hedging instruments. The interest rate swaps are recorded in the accompanying consolidated financial statements at their fair&#13;value with the unrealized gains and losses recorded in interest expense.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;When&#13;the Company enters into a financial instrument such as a debt or equity agreement (the &amp;#8220;host contract&amp;#8221;), the Company&#13;assesses whether the economic characteristics of any embedded features are clearly and closely related to the primary economic&#13;characteristics of the remainder of the host contract. When it is determined that (i) an embedded feature possesses economic characteristics&#13;that are not clearly and closely related to the primary economic characteristics of the host contract, and (ii) a separate, stand-alone&#13;instrument with the same terms would meet the definition of a financial derivative instrument, then the embedded feature is bifurcated&#13;from the host contract and accounted for as a derivative instrument. The estimated fair value of the derivative feature is recorded&#13;separately from the carrying value of the host contract, with subsequent changes in the estimated fair value recorded as a non-operating&#13;gain or loss in the Company&amp;#8217;s consolidated statements of operations.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&lt;b&gt;&lt;i&gt;Income&#13;Taxes&lt;/i&gt;&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;The&#13;Company accounts for income taxes under the asset and liability method. Under this method, deferred income tax assets and liabilities&#13;are determined based on differences between financial reporting and tax bases of assets and liabilities and are measured using&#13;enacted tax rates and laws that are expected to be in effect when the differences are expected to be recovered or settled. Realization&#13;of deferred income tax assets is dependent upon future taxable income. A valuation allowance is recognized if it is more likely&#13;than not that some portion or all of a deferred income tax asset will not be realized based on the weight of available evidence,&#13;including expected future earnings.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;The&#13;Company recognizes an uncertain tax position in its financial statements when it concludes that a tax position is more likely&#13;than not to be sustained upon examination based solely on its technical merits. Only after a tax position passes the first step&#13;of recognition will measurement be required. Under the measurement step, the tax benefit is measured as the largest amount of&#13;benefit that is more likely than not to be realized upon effective settlement. This is determined on a cumulative probability&#13;basis. The full impact of any change in recognition or measurement is reflected in the period in which such change occurs. Interest&#13;and penalties related to income taxes are recognized in the provision for income taxes.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&lt;b&gt;&lt;i&gt;Foreign&#13;Currency Translation&lt;/i&gt;&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;The&#13;Company&amp;#8217;s reporting currency is the U.S.&amp;#160;Dollar, while the functional currencies of its foreign subsidiaries are their&#13;respective local currencies. A majority of Morinda&amp;#8217;s business operations occur outside the United States. The local currency&#13;of each of the Morinda&amp;#8217;s international subsidiaries and branches is used as its functional currency. All assets and liabilities&#13;are translated into U.S. dollars at exchange rates existing at the consolidated balance sheet date, and net revenue and expenses&#13;are translated at monthly average exchange rates. The resulting net foreign currency translation adjustments are recorded in accumulated&#13;other comprehensive income as a separate component of stockholders&amp;#8217; equity in the consolidated balance sheets. Gains and&#13;losses from foreign currency transactions and remeasurement gains (losses) on short-term intercompany borrowings, are recorded&#13;in other income and expense in the consolidated statements of operations and comprehensive loss. The tax effect has not been material&#13;to date.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&lt;b&gt;&lt;i&gt;Loss&#13;Per Common Share&lt;/i&gt;&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;Basic&#13;net loss per common share is computed by dividing the net loss applicable to common stockholders by the weighted average number&#13;of common shares outstanding for each period presented. Diluted net loss per common share is computed by giving effect to all&#13;potential shares of Common Stock, including unvested restricted stock awards, stock options, convertible debt, Preferred Stock&#13;and warrants, to the extent dilutive.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&lt;b&gt;&lt;i&gt;Recent&#13;Accounting Pronouncements&lt;/i&gt;&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&lt;i&gt;Recently&#13;Adopted Standards.&lt;/i&gt; The following recently issued accounting standards were adopted during fiscal year 2018:&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0 0 0 0.25in&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0 0 0 0.25in&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;In&#13;May 2014, the FASB issued ASU No.&amp;#160;2014-09, &lt;i&gt;Revenue from Contracts with Customers&lt;/i&gt;, which supersedes nearly&#13;all existing revenue recognition standards under U.S. GAAP. The new standard provides a five-step process for recognizing&#13;revenue that depicts the transfer of promised goods or services to customers in an amount that reflects the consideration to&#13;which the entity expects to be entitled in exchange for those goods or services. The Company adopted this ASU using the&#13;full retrospective method effective January 1, 2018. The impact of adoption of this ASU was immaterial and, accordingly,&#13;there were no changes to the previously issued financial statements for the year ended Decemebr 31, 2017.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0 0 0 0.25in&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0 0 0 0.25in&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;In&#13;August 2016, the Financial Accounting Standards Board (&amp;#8220;FASB&amp;#8221;) issued Accounting Standards Update (&amp;#8220;ASU&amp;#8221;)&#13;No. 2016-15, &lt;i&gt;Statement of Cash Flows, Classification of Certain Cash Receipts and Cash Payments.&amp;#160;&lt;/i&gt;The new standard&#13;is intended to reduce diversity in practice in how certain cash receipts and cash payments are classified in the statements of&#13;cash flows and must be adopted retrospectively for each prior reporting period presented upon initial adoption. ASU 2016-15 was&#13;adopted effective January 1, 2018 and did not have a material impact on the Company&amp;#8217;s consolidated financial statements&#13;for the years ended December 31, 2018 and 2017. Accordingly, there were no transactions that required retrospective adjustments&#13;in the consolidated statements of cash flows for the year ended December 31, 2017.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0 0 0 0.25in&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;In&#13;November 2016, the FASB issued ASU No. 2016-18,&amp;#160;&lt;i&gt;Statement of Cash&amp;#160;Flows &amp;#8211; Restricted Cash&lt;/i&gt;, which requires&#13;entities that have restricted cash or restricted cash equivalents to reconcile the change during the period in the total cash,&#13;cash equivalents, and amounts generally described as restricted cash or restricted cash equivalents in its statement of cash flows.&#13;As a result, amounts generally described as cash and restricted cash equivalents should be included with cash and cash equivalents&#13;shown on the statement of cash flows. The Company adopted this standard during 2018 using the retrospective transition method.&#13;The adoption did not result in any changes to the Company&amp;#8217;s previously reported consolidated statements of cash flows for&#13;the year ended December 31, 2017.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0 0 0 0.25in&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0 0 0 0.25in&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;In&#13;May 2017, the FASB issued ASU No. 2017-09,&amp;#160;&lt;i&gt;Compensation&amp;#8212;Stock Compensation: Scope of Modification Accounting&lt;/i&gt;,&#13;which provides clarification on when modification accounting should be used for changes to the terms or conditions of a share-based&#13;payment award. This standard does not change the accounting for modifications of share-based payment awards but clarifies that&#13;modification accounting guidance should only be applied if there is a change to the value, vesting conditions, or award classification&#13;and would not be required if the changes are considered non-substantive. This standard was adopted by the Company in the first&#13;quarter of fiscal 2018 and did not have a material impact on its consolidated financial statements.&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&lt;i&gt;Standards&#13;Required to be Adopted in Future Years.&lt;/i&gt; The following accounting standards are not yet effective; management has not completed&#13;its evaluation to determine the impact that adoption of these standards will have on the Company&amp;#8217;s consolidated financial&#13;statements.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0 0 0 0.25in&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0 0 0 0.25in&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;In&#13;June 2016, the FASB issued ASU 2016-13, &lt;i&gt;Financial Instruments - Credit Losses (Topic 326): Measurement of Credit Losses on&#13;Financial Instruments.&lt;/i&gt;&amp;#160; ASU 2016-13 amends the guidance on the impairment of financial instruments. &amp;#160;This update&#13;adds an impairment model (known as the current expected credit losses model) that is based on expected losses rather than incurred&#13;losses. &amp;#160;Under the new guidance, an entity recognizes, as an allowance, its estimate of expected credit losses. &amp;#160;In&#13;November 2018, ASU 2016-13 was amended by ASU 2018-19, &lt;i&gt;Codification Improvements to Topic 326, Financial Instruments&#13;&amp;#8211; Credit Losses.&lt;/i&gt; &amp;#160;ASU 2018-19 changes the effective date of the credit loss standards (ASU 2016-13) to fiscal&#13;years beginning after December 15, 2021, including interim periods within those fiscal years. Further, the ASU clarifies that&#13;operating lease receivables are not within the scope of ASC 326-20 and should instead be accounted for under the new leasing standard,&#13;ASC 842.&amp;#160; &amp;#160;The Company has not yet determined the effect that ASU 2018-19 will have on its results operations, balance&#13;sheets or financial statement disclosures.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0 0 0 0.25in&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;In&#13;January 2017, the FASB issued ASU No. 2017-04, &lt;i&gt;Intangibles - Goodwill and Other (Topic 350): Simplifying the Test for Goodwill&#13;Impairment.&lt;/i&gt; The amendments in this ASU simplify the subsequent measurement of goodwill by eliminating Step 2 from the goodwill&#13;impairment test and eliminating the requirement for a reporting unit with a zero or negative carrying amount to perform a qualitative&#13;assessment. Instead, under this ASU, an entity would perform its annual, or interim, goodwill impairment test by comparing the&#13;fair value of a reporting unit with its carrying amount and would recognize an impairment charge for the amount by which the carrying&#13;amount exceeds the reporting unit&amp;#8217;s fair value; however, the loss recognized is not to exceed the total amount of goodwill&#13;allocated to that reporting unit. In addition, income tax effects will be considered, if applicable. This ASU is effective for&#13;fiscal years, and interim periods within those fiscal years, beginning after December 15, 2019. Early adoption is permitted. The&#13;Company is currently evaluating the impact of this ASU on its consolidated financial statements and related disclosures.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0 0 0 0.25in&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=margin: 0pt; font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
&lt;p style=margin: 0pt; font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;The&#13;Company completed business combinations with Morinda in December 2018, and Maverick, PMC and Marley during 2017. Each of these&#13;business combinations was accounted for using the acquisition method of accounting based on ASC 805,&amp;#160;&lt;i&gt;Business Combinations&lt;/i&gt;,&#13;and using the fair value concepts set forth in ASC&amp;#160;820,&amp;#160;&lt;i&gt;Fair Value Measurement&lt;/i&gt;. The key terms of each of these&#13;business combinations are discussed below.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&lt;b&gt;&lt;i&gt;Morinda&#13;Holdings, Inc.&lt;/i&gt;&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;On&#13;December 2, 2018, the Company entered into a Plan of Merger (the &amp;#8220;Merger Agreement&amp;#8221;) with Morinda and New Age Health&#13;Sciences Holdings, Inc., a newly formed Utah corporation and wholly-owned subsidiary of the Company (&amp;#8220;Merger Sub&amp;#8221;).&#13;On December 21, 2018 (the &amp;#8220;Closing Date&amp;#8221;), the transactions contemplated by the Merger Agreement were completed. Merger&#13;Sub was merged with and into Morinda and Morinda became a wholly-owned subsidiary of the Company. This transaction is referred&#13;to herein as the &amp;#8220;Merger.&amp;#8221;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;Pursuant&#13;to the Merger Agreement, the Company paid to Morinda&amp;#8217;s equity holders (i) $75.0 million in cash; (ii) 2,016,480 shares of&#13;the Company&amp;#8217;s Common Stock with an estimated fair value on the closing Date of approximately $11.0 million, (iii) 43,804&#13;shares of Series D Preferred Stock (the &amp;#8220;Preferred Stock&amp;#8221;) providing for the potential payment of up to $15 million&#13;contingent upon Morinda achieving certain post-closing milestones, as discussed below.&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;Pursuant&#13;to the Certificate of Designations of Series D Preferred Stock (the &amp;#8220;CoD&amp;#8221;), the holders of the Preferred Stock are&#13;entitled to receive a dividend of up to an aggregate of $15.0 million (the &amp;#8220;Milestone Dividend&amp;#8221;) if the Adjusted EBITDA&#13;(as defined in the CoD) of Morinda is at least $20.0 million for the year ending December 31, 2019. The Milestone Dividend is&#13;payable on April 15, 2020. If the Adjusted EBITDA of Morinda is less than $20.0 million, the Milestone Dividend shall be reduced&#13;by applying a five-times multiple to the difference between the Adjusted EBITDA target of $20 million and actual Adjusted EBITDA&#13;for the year ending December 31, 2019. Accordingly, no Milestone Dividend is payable if actual Adjusted EBITDA is $17.0 million&#13;or lower. Additionally, the Company is required to pay quarterly dividends to the holders of the Preferred Stock at a rate of&#13;1.5% per annum of the Milestone Dividend amount, payable on a pro rata basis. The Company may pay the Milestone Dividend and /or&#13;the annual dividend in cash or in kind, provided that if the Company chooses to pay in kind, the shares of Common Stock issued&#13;as payment therefore must be registered under the Securities Act of 1933, as amended (the &amp;#8220;Securities Act&amp;#8221;). The Preferred&#13;Stock shall terminate on April 15, 2020.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;Prior&#13;to the Merger, Morinda was an S corporation for U.S. federal and state income tax purposes. Accordingly, Morinda&amp;#8217;s taxable&#13;earnings were reported on the individual income tax returns of the stockholders who were responsible for payment of the related&#13;income tax liabilities.&amp;#160;In December 2018, Morinda agreed to distribute to its stockholders approximately $39.6 million of&#13;its previously-taxed S corporation earnings whereby distributions are payable (i)&amp;#160;up to $25.0 million for which the timing&#13;and amount are subject to a future financing event, and (ii)&amp;#160;approximately $14.6 million based on the calculation of&amp;#160;excess&#13;working capital (&amp;#8220;EWC&amp;#8221;)&amp;#160;as of the Closing Date. EWC is the amount by which Morinda&amp;#8217;s actual working capital&#13;(as defined in the Merger Agreement) on the Closing Date exceeds $25.0 million.&amp;#160;The Closing Date balance sheet of Morinda&#13;indicated that EWC was approximately $14.6 million as of the Closing Date.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;Under&#13;ASC 805, acquisition-related transaction costs (e.g., advisory, legal and other professional fees) are not included as a component&#13;of consideration transferred but are accounted for as expenses in the periods in which such costs are incurred.&amp;#160; In connection&#13;with the Merger, the Company incurred transaction costs of $3.2 million, including (i) payment of cash of $1.1 million and issuance&#13;of 214,250 shares of Common Stock with a fair value of $1.2 million to a financial advisor that assisted with the consummation&#13;of the Merger, and (ii) professional fees and other incremental and direct costs associated with the Merger of $0.9 million.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&lt;b&gt;&lt;i&gt;Maverick&#13;Brands, LLC&lt;/i&gt;&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;On&#13;March 31, 2017, the Company acquired all of the assets of Maverick. Maverick was engaged in the manufacturing and sale&#13;of coconut water and other beverages, and the acquisition helped the Company expand its capabilities and product offerings.&#13;The operating results of Maverick have been consolidated with those of the Company beginning April 1, 2017. Total&#13;purchase consideration consisted of (i) $2.0 million of cash and (ii) 2.2 million shares of Common Stock valued at the&#13;closing price on the date of the acquisition of $4.13 per share for a total of $9.1 million. All of the goodwill and&#13;intangible assets from the Maverick acquisition are deductible for income tax purposes and are included in the&#13;Company&amp;#8217;s  New Age segment. The fair value of the identifiable assets included (i) customer relationships using the&#13;income approach with a fair value of $1.0 million, and (ii) the trade name with a fair value of $4.9 million and recipes with&#13;a fair value of $0.8 million, both determined using the market approach. In connection with the acquisition of Maverick, the&#13;Company incurred transactional expenses totaling $0.2 million.&amp;#160;Goodwill related to Maverick was recognized for the&#13;difference between the total consideration transferred to consummate the acquisition of $11.1 million and the fair value of&#13;net identifiable assets acquired of $5.9 million.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&lt;b&gt;&lt;i&gt;PMC&#13;Holdings, Inc.&lt;/i&gt;&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;On&#13;May 23, 2017, closing occurred pursuant to an Asset Purchase Agreement whereby the Company acquired substantially all of the operating&#13;assets of PMC, which was a company engaged in the business of developing, manufacturing, selling and marketing micronutrient products&#13;and formulations.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;The&#13;Company received substantially all of the operating assets of PMC, consisting of patents and equipment in exchange for&#13;consideration of 1.2 million shares of Common Stock with a fair value of $5.5 million based on a closing price of $4.58 per&#13;share. All of the goodwill and intangible assets from the PMC acquisition are deductible for income tax purposes and are&#13;included in the Company&amp;#8217;s  New Age segment. Fair value of the patents was determined using the market approach by an&#13;independent third-party valuation specialist. Goodwill related to PMC was recognized for the difference between the total&#13;consideration transferred to consummate the acquisition of $5.5 million and the fair value of net identifiable assets&#13;acquired of $3.7 million.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&lt;b&gt;&lt;i&gt;Marley&#13;Beverage Company, LLC&lt;/i&gt;&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;On&#13;March 23, 2017, the Company entered into an asset purchase agreement whereby the Company acquired substantially all of the operating&#13;assets of Marley, which was a company engaged in the development, manufacturing, selling and marketing of nonalcoholic relaxation&#13;teas and sparkling waters, and ready-to-drink coffee drinks. Closing for the acquisition occurred on June 13, 2017. At closing,&#13;the Company received substantially all of the operating assets of Marley, consisting of inventory, accounts receivable, property&#13;and equipment, intellectual property, and worldwide licensing rights in perpetuity to all non-alcoholic Marley RTD beverages in&#13;exchange for consideration consisting of 3.0 million shares of Common Stock with a fair value of $18.6 million based on a closing&#13;price of $6.20 per share.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;In&#13;addition, the Company is obligated to make a single earnout payment of $1.25 million at such time that revenue for the Marley&#13;reporting unit is equal to or greater than $15.0 million during any trailing twelve calendar month period after the closing. Payment&#13;for 50% of the $1.25 million is due within 15 days after the month in which the earnout payment is triggered, 25% is payable one&#13;year after the first payment, and the remaining 25% is payable two years after the first payment. The fair value of the earnout&#13;was valued using the weighted average return on assets and amounted to $0.8 million on the closing date. As of December 31, 2018,&#13;the fair value of this earnout has increased to $0.9 million.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;All&#13;of the goodwill and intangible assets from the Marley acquisition are deductible for income tax purposes and are included in&#13;the Company&amp;#8217;s  New Age segment. The fair value of the identifiable assets included (i) customer relationships using&#13;the cost approach with a fair value of $0.6 million, and (ii) the license agreement with a fair value of $5.8 million and&#13;recipes with a fair value of $2.7 million, both determined using the market approach. Goodwill related to Marley was&#13;recognized for the difference between the total consideration transferred to consummate the acquisition of $19.4 million and&#13;the fair value of net identifiable assets acquired of $10.0 million.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&lt;b&gt;&lt;i&gt;Summary&#13;of Purchase Consideration&lt;/i&gt;&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times

 Serif&gt;Fair&#13;    value was determined based on the closing price of the Company&amp;#8217;s Common Stock on the Closing Date.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&#13;&lt;/table&gt;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;table cellpadding=0 style=width: 100%; font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&#13;&lt;tr style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=vertical-align: top; width: 48px; padding-left: 0.25in; font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;(2)&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=padding: 0.75pt; text-align: justify; font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;Earnout&#13;    consideration represents the fair value of the Series D Preferred Stock based on the probability of achieving the Milestone&#13;    Dividend, whereby the maximum Milestone Dividend is $15.0 million&amp;#160;if the Adjusted EBITDA of Morinda is $20.0 million&#13;    or more. The earnout consideration is expected to be finalized by the first quarter of 2020 and is required to be paid on&#13;    April 30, 2020. The fair value of the earn-out was determined using an option pricing model.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&#13;&lt;/table&gt;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times

 Serif&gt;_________________&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;table cellpadding=0 style=width: 100%; font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&#13;&lt;tr style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=vertical-align: top; width: 48px; padding-left: 0.25in; font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;(1)&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=padding: 0.75pt; text-align: justify; font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;Based&#13;    on the report of an independent valuation specialist, the fair value of work-in-process and finished goods inventories on&#13;    the Closing Date exceeded the historical carrying value by approximately $2.2 million. This amount represents an element of&#13;    built-in profit on the Closing Date and will be charged to cost of goods sold as the related inventories are sold, which is&#13;    expected to occur within approximately six months after the Closing Date. The fair value of inventories was determined using&#13;    both the &amp;#8220;cost approach&amp;#8221; and the &amp;#8220;market approach&amp;#8221;.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&#13;&lt;/table&gt;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;table cellpadding=0 style=width: 100%; font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&#13;&lt;tr style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=vertical-align: top; width: 48px; padding-left: 0.25in; font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;(2)&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=padding: 0.75pt; text-align: justify; font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;Fair&#13;    value of Morinda&amp;#8217;s real estate properties amounted to $44.4 million and was based upon real estate appraisals prepared&#13;    by an independent firm, primarily using the &amp;#8220;income approach&amp;#8221;. Fair value of other property and equipment amounted&#13;    to $10.9 million and was based primarily on the report of an independent valuation specialist with fair value determined using&#13;    both the &amp;#8220;cost approach&amp;#8221; and the &amp;#8220;market approach&amp;#8221;.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&#13;&lt;/table&gt;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;table cellpadding=0 style=width: 100%; font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&#13;&lt;tr style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=vertical-align: top; width: 48px; padding-left: 0.25in; font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;(3)&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=padding: 0.75pt; text-align: justify; font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;The&#13;    fair value of identifiable intangible assets was $45.9 million and was determined based on the report of an independent valuation&#13;    specialist, primarily using variations of the &amp;#8220;income approach,&amp;#8221; which is based on the present value of the future&#13;    after-tax cash flows attributable to each identifiable intangible asset.&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&#13;&lt;/table&gt;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;table cellpadding=0 style=width: 100%; font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&#13;&lt;tr style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=vertical-align: top; width: 48px; padding-left: 0.25in; font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;(4)&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=padding: 0.75pt; text-align: justify; font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;In&#13;    order to conform with the Company&amp;#8217;s accounting policies, Morinda adopted ASU No. 2016-02,&amp;#160;&lt;i&gt;Leases&lt;/i&gt;, which&#13;    requires that assets and liabilities be recognized on the balance sheet for the rights and obligations created by those leases.&amp;#160;Accordingly,&#13;    operating lease right of use assets of $13.4 million were recognized.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&#13;&lt;/table&gt;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;table cellpadding=0 style=width: 100%; font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&#13;&lt;tr style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=vertical-align: top; width: 48px; padding-left: 0.25in; font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;(5)&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=padding: 0.75pt; text-align: justify; font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&lt;p style=margin-top: 0; margin-bottom: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;Morinda&amp;#8217;s&#13;                                                                                              U.S. operations were previously taxed as a subchapter S Corporation whereby no deferred income tax assets or liabilities had&#13;                                                                                              been recognized for U.S. federal and state income tax purposes. Upon consummation of the Merger, Morinda&amp;#8217;s U.S.&#13;                                                                                              operations are included in the consolidated income tax returnsof the Company. Accordingly, an adjustment of approximately&#13;                                                                                              $9.9 million has been reflected for net deferred income tax liabilities that resulted from differences between the financial&#13;                                                                                              reporting basis and the income tax basis of such U.S. assets and liabilities.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&#13;&lt;/table&gt;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;table cellpadding=0 style=width: 100%; font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&#13;&lt;tr style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=vertical-align: top; width: 48px; padding-left: 0.25in; font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;(6)&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=padding: 0.75pt; text-align: justify; font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;Goodwill&#13;    related to Morinda is recognized for the difference between the total consideration transferred to consummate the Merger of&#13;    $99.1 million and the fair value of net identifiable assets acquired of $88.8 million. Goodwill and intangible assets in&#13;    connection with the Morinda business combination are not expected to be deductible for income tax purposes.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&#13;&lt;/table&gt;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&lt;b&gt;&lt;i&gt;Business&#13;Combination Liabilities&lt;/i&gt;&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times

 Serif&gt;(1)&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=padding: 0.75pt; text-align: justify; font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;Revenue&#13;    for the Marley reporting unit is not expected to exceed the $15.0 million earnout threshold during 2019. The fair value of&#13;    the earnout was valued using the weighted average return on assets whereby the fair value increased from $0.8 million to $0.9&#13;    million during 2018. The increase in the fair value of the earnout of $0.1 million is recognized as an expense for the year&#13;    ended December 31, 2018.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&#13;&lt;/table&gt;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;table cellpadding=0 style=width: 100%; font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&#13;&lt;tr style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=vertical-align: top; width: 48px; padding-left: 0.25in; font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;(2)&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=padding: 0.75pt; text-align: justify; font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;Pursuant&#13;    to a separate agreement between the parties, EWC is payable to Morinda&amp;#8217;s stockholders for $1.0 million in April 2019,&#13;    $8.0 million in July 2019, and the remainder of $5.5 million is payable in July 2020.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&#13;&lt;/table&gt;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;table cellpadding=0 style=width: 100%; font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&#13;&lt;tr style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=vertical-align: top; width: 48px; padding-left: 0.25in; font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;(3)&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=padding: 0.75pt; text-align: justify; font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;The&#13;    fair value of earnout consideration under the Series D Preferred Stock is based on the probability of achieving the Milestone&#13;    Dividend, whereby the maximum Milestone Dividend is $15.0 million&amp;#160;if the Adjusted EBITDA of Morinda is $20.0 million&#13;    or more. The fair value of the earnout of $13.1 million was determined using an option pricing model and will continue to&#13;    be adjusted to fair value each quarter during 2019 as additional information becomes available.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&#13;&lt;/table&gt;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;table cellpadding=0 style=width: 100%; font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&#13;&lt;tr style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=vertical-align: top; width: 48px; padding-left: 0.25in; font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;(4)&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=padding: 0.75pt; text-align: justify; font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;Pursuant&#13;    to a separate agreement between the parties, Morinda agreed to pay its former stockholders up to $25.0 million from the net&#13;    proceeds of a   sale leaseback to be completed after the Closing Date. As discussed in Note 16, the closing for this&#13;    transaction occurred on March 22, 2019. Accordingly,     since this     payment     was     made from     the proceeds of a&#13;    long-term     financing,     the net     carrying     value is classified     as a     long-term     liability in the&#13;    accompanying     consolidated     balance sheet     as of     December 31, 2018.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&#13;&lt;/table&gt;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;table cellpadding=0 style=width: 100%; font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&#13;&lt;tr style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=vertical-align: top; width: 48px; padding-left: 0.25in; font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;(5)&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=padding: 0.75pt; text-align: justify; font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;Interest&#13;    was imputed on these obligations based on a credit and tax adjusted interest rate of 6.1% for the period from the Closing&#13;    Date until the respective contractual or estimated payment dates. This discount is being accreted using the effective interest&#13;    method.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&#13;&lt;/table&gt;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 8pt Times New Roman

 Serif; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&lt;b&gt;&lt;i&gt;Pro&#13;Forma Disclosures&lt;/i&gt;&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;The&#13;following unaudited pro forma financial results reflects the historical operating results of the Company, including the unaudited&#13;pro forma results of Morinda, Maverick, PMC and Marley for the years ended December 31, 2018 and 2017, respectively, as if each&#13;of these four business combinations had occurred as of January 1, 2017. The pro forma financial information set forth below reflects&#13;adjustments to the historical data of the Company to give effect to each of these acquisitions and the related equity issuances&#13;as if each had occurred on January&amp;#160;1, 2017. The pro forma information presented below does not purport to represent what&#13;the actual results of operations would have been for the periods indicated, nor does it purport to represent the Company&amp;#8217;s&#13;future results of operations. The following table summarizes on an unaudited pro forma basis the Company&amp;#8217;s results of operations&#13;for the years ended December 31, 2018 and 2017 (in thousands, except per share amounts):&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 8pt Times New Roman

 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 8pt Times New Roman

 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;The&#13;calculations of pro forma net revenue and pro forma net loss give effect to the business combinations for the period from January&#13;1, 2017 until the respective closing dates for (i) the historical net revenue and net income (loss), as applicable, of the acquired&#13;businesses, (ii) incremental depreciation and amortization for each business combination based on the fair value of property,&#13;equipment and identifiable intangible assets acquired and the related estimated useful lives, and (iii) recognition of accretion&#13;of discounts on obligations with extended payment terms that were assumed in the business combinations.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
&lt;p style=margin: 0pt; font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 8pt Times New Roman

 Serif&gt;The&#13;Company leases various office and warehouse facilities, vehicles and equipment under non-cancellable operating lease agreements&#13;that expire between January 2019 and May 2030. For the years ended December 31, 2018 and 2017, the Company had operating lease&#13;expense of $1.6 million and $0.7 million respectively.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman

 Serif&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;Represents&#13;    ROU lease asset and corresponding ROU lease liabilities assumed in the Merger with Morinda as discussed in Note 3. The present&#13;    value of the ROU lease liabilities assumed in the Merger was based on the Company&amp;#8217;s implicit borrowing rate of 6.1%&#13;    on the Closing Date.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&#13;&lt;/table&gt;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;As&#13;of December 31, 2018 and 2017, the weighted average remaining lease term under ROU leases was 5.9 and 9.2 years, respectively.&#13;As of December 31, 2018 and 2017, the weighted average discount rate for ROU lease liabilities was approximately 7% and 10%, respectively.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&lt;b&gt;&lt;i&gt;Sale&#13;Leaseback&lt;/i&gt;&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;On&#13;January 10, 2017, the Company entered into an agreement with an unaffiliated third party resulting in the sale for $8.9 million&#13;of the land and building that serves as the Company&amp;#8217;s corporate headquarters in Denver, Colorado. Concurrently with the&#13;sale, the Company entered into a lease of this property for an initial term of ten years, with two options to extend for successive&#13;five-year periods. The monthly lease cost is $52,000 for the initial year, with 2% annual increases for each year thereafter.&#13;The Company determined that this transaction qualified as a sale under ASU 2016-02 (&amp;#8220;&lt;i&gt;Leases&lt;/i&gt;&amp;#8221;), which the Company&#13;adopted effective January 1, 2017. Therefore, a gain of approximately $3.3 million was recognized for the year ended December&#13;31, 2017. In connection with the leaseback, the Company recognized an ROU lease asset and a corresponding ROU lease liability&#13;for approximately $4.3 million. The present value of the ROU lease liability was based on the Company&amp;#8217;s implicit borrowing&#13;rate of 10.0% on the closing date.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&lt;b&gt;&lt;i&gt;Lease&#13;Commitments&lt;/i&gt;&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times

 Serif&gt;24,392&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=font: 8pt Times New Roman

 Serif&gt;Less&#13;    imputed interest&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=padding-bottom: 1.5pt; font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=border-bottom: black 1pt solid; font: 8pt Times New Roman

 Serif&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
