 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=border-bottom: black 1pt solid; font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; text-align: right&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;(5,908&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=padding-bottom: 1.5pt; font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;)&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&#13;&lt;tr style=vertical-align: bottom; font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=text-indent: 27pt; font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;Present&#13;    value of minimum lease payments&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=padding-bottom: 3pt; font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=border-bottom: black 1pt double; font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;$&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=border-bottom: black 1pt double; font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; text-align: right&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;18,484&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=padding-bottom: 3pt; font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&#13;&lt;/table&gt;&#13;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=margin: 0pt; font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
&lt;p style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&lt;b&gt;&lt;i&gt;Siena&#13;Revolver&lt;/i&gt;&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;On&#13;August 10, 2018 (the &amp;#8220;Closing Date&amp;#8221;), the Company entered into a loan and security agreement with Siena Lending Group&#13;LLC (&amp;#8220;Siena&amp;#8221;) that provides for a $12.0 million revolving credit facility (the &amp;#8220;Siena Revolver&amp;#8221;) with&#13;a scheduled maturity date of August 10, 2021 (the &amp;#8220;Maturity Date&amp;#8221;). Outstanding borrowings bear interest at the greater&#13;of (i) 7.5% or (ii) the prime rate plus 2.75%. As of December 31, 2018, the effective interest rate was 8.25%. Beginning on November&#13;7, 2018, the Company was required to pay interest on a minimum of $2.0 million of borrowings, regardless of whether such funds&#13;had been borrowed. The Siena Revolver also provides for an unused line fee equal to 0.5% per annum of the undrawn portion of the&#13;$12.0 million commitment. The Siena Revolver is subject to availability based on eligible accounts receivables and eligible inventory&#13;of the Company. As of December&amp;#160;31, 2018, the borrowing base calculation permitted total borrowings of approximately $2.5&#13;million. After deducting the outstanding principal balance of $2.0 million, the Company had excess borrowing availability of $0.5&#13;million. Pursuant to the Siena Revolver, the Company granted a security interest in substantially all assets and intellectual&#13;property of the Company and its subsidiaries, except for such assets owned by Morinda. Siena&amp;#8217;s obligation to fund loans&#13;was subject to the satisfaction of certain closing conditions, including the requirement to raise debt or equity which was satisfied&#13;during the fourth quarter of 2018.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;The&#13;Siena Revolver contains standard and customary events of default including, but not limited to, maintaining compliance with the&#13;financial and non-financial covenants set forth in the Siena Revolver. The financial covenants require maintenance of a fixed&#13;charge coverage ratio of no less than 1.1 if excess borrowing availability is less than $1.0 million, and to maintain minimum&#13;liquidity of $2.0 million. The fixed charge coverage ratio compares EBITDA, net of unfinanced capital expenditures, to fixed charges&#13;for the latest quarterly reporting period. As of December 31, 2018, the Company was in compliance with the financial covenants.&#13;The Siena Revolver also limits or prohibits the Company from paying dividends, incurring additional debt, selling significant&#13;assets, or merging with other entities without the consent of the lenders. The Siena Revolver also includes an event of default&#13;if Brent Willis ceases to be employed as chief executive officer or if Greg Gould ceases to be employed as the chief financial&#13;officer, unless a successor is appointed within 60 days and such successor is reasonably satisfactory to the Lender.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;In&#13;connection with the financing, the Company incurred a financial advisor fee, a closing fee and professional fees for a total of&#13;$0.4 million. This amount is being accounted for as debt issuance costs that is being amortized using the straight-line method&#13;over the three-year term of the Siena Revolver.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;The&#13;Siena Revolver includes a lockbox arrangement that requires the Company to direct its customers to remit payments to a restricted&#13;bank account, whereby all available funds are used to pay down the outstanding principal balance under the Siena Revolver. Accordingly,&#13;the entire outstanding principal balance of the Siena Revolver is classified as a current liability as of December 31, 2018. [As&#13;discussed in Note 16, the Siena Revolver was paid off and terminated on March 29, 2019.]&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&lt;b&gt;&lt;i&gt;Embedded&#13;Derivatives&lt;/i&gt;&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;The&#13;Siena Revolver includes features that were determined to be embedded derivatives requiring bifurcation and accounting as separate&#13;financial instruments. The Company determined that embedded derivatives include the requirement to pay (i) an early termination&#13;premium if the Siena Revolver is terminated before the Maturity Date, and (ii) default interest at a 5.0% premium if events of&#13;default exist. An early termination premium is required to be paid if Siena&amp;#8217;s commitment to make revolving loans is terminated&#13;prior to the Maturity Date. The fee is equal to 4.00%, 2.25% and 1.25% of the $12.0 million commitment if termination occurs during&#13;the first, second and third years after the Closing Date, respectively. These embedded derivatives are classified within Level&#13;3 of the fair value hierarchy. Fair value was estimated using the &amp;#8220;with&amp;#8221; and &amp;#8220;without&amp;#8221; method. Accordingly,&#13;the Siena Revolver was first valued with the embedded derivatives (the &amp;#8220;with&amp;#8221; scenario) and subsequently valued without&#13;the embedded derivatives (the &amp;#8220;without&amp;#8221; scenario). The fair value of the embedded derivatives was estimated as the&#13;difference between these two scenarios.&amp;#160;The fair values were determined using the income approach, specifically the yield&#13;method. As of December 31, 2018, key Level 3 assumptions and estimates used in the valuation of the embedded derivatives included&#13;an assessment of the probability of early termination of the Siena Revolver, the remaining term to maturity of approximately 2.6&#13;years, probability of default of approximately 10%, and a discount rate of 6.1%.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;As&#13;of December 31, 2018, the embedded derivatives for the Siena Revolver have an aggregate fair value of approximately $0.5 million,&#13;which is included in accrued liabilities as of December 31, 2018. The Company recognized a loss on change in fair value of embedded&#13;derivatives of $0.5 million which is included in non-operating expenses for the year ended December 31, 2018.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&lt;b&gt;&lt;i&gt;Summary&#13;of Debt&lt;/i&gt;&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;As&#13;of December 31, 2018 and 2017, debt consists of the following (in thousands):&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;table cellspacing=0 cellpadding=0 style=font: 8pt Times New Roman

 Serif; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;table cellpadding=0 style=width: 100%; font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&#13;&lt;tr style=font: 8pt Times New Roman

 Serif&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=vertical-align: top; width: 48px; padding-left: 0.25in; font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;(1)&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=padding: 0.75pt; text-align: justify; font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;This&#13;    mortgage note payable is collateralized by land and a building in Japan. Quarterly principal payments of $0.3 million plus&#13;    interest is payable in Japanese Yen at TIBOR plus 0.7% (0.76% as of December 31, 2018). The maturity date is in December 2020.&#13;    This debt is subject to the interest rate swap agreement discussed below, which essentially fixes the interest rate on this&#13;    loan at approximately 2.0%.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&#13;&lt;/table&gt;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;table cellpadding=0 style=width: 100%; font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&#13;&lt;tr style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=vertical-align: top; width: 48px; padding-left: 0.25in; font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;(2)&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=padding: 0.75pt; text-align: justify; font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;Consists&#13;    of various installment notes payable that are collateralized by equipment and that bear interest at 12.4% to 22.1%.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&#13;&lt;/table&gt;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;table cellpadding=0 style=width: 100%; font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&#13;&lt;tr style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=vertical-align: top; width: 48px; padding-left: 0.25in; font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;(3)&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=padding: 0.75pt; text-align: justify; font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;On&#13;    July 6, 2017, the Company entered into a revolving credit agreement with U.S. Bank National Association (the &amp;#8220;U.S. Bank&#13;    Revolver&amp;#8221;). Maximum borrowings were $2,000,000, subject to borrowing base requirements under the agreement. The credit&#13;    agreement provided for interest at 2.5% plus the Daily Reset LIBOR Rate (4.6% as of December 31, 2017). The maturity date&#13;    was in July 2018 and the entire balance plus accrued interest was repaid in June 2018.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&#13;&lt;/table&gt;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;table cellpadding=0 style=width: 100%; font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&#13;&lt;tr style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=vertical-align: top; width: 48px; padding-left: 0.25in; font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;(4)&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=padding: 0.75pt; text-align: justify; font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;In&#13;    connection with the acquisition of Maverick, the Company assumed Maverick&amp;#8217;s Series B notes payable that provided for&#13;    interest at approximately 10.0% per annum. Monthly payments of interest only were due until the maturity date in December&#13;    2018. The principal balance plus accrued interest of $0.1 million was converted to an aggregate of 0.8 million shares of Common&#13;    Stock in 2018.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&#13;&lt;/table&gt;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 8pt Times New Roman

 Times
 Serif&gt;&lt;b&gt;&lt;i&gt;Interest&#13;Rate Swap Agreement&lt;/i&gt;&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman

 Times
 Serif; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;The&#13;amount of unrealized loss from interest rate swaps at December 31, 2018, was approximately $36,000, and is included in other long-term&#13;liabilities in the accompanying consolidated balance sheet. At December 31, 2018, the Company had one contract for an interest&#13;rate swap with a total notional amount of approximately $2.6 million.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 8pt Times New Roman

 Serif&gt;&lt;b&gt;&lt;i&gt;Convertible&#13;Note&lt;/i&gt;&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;On&#13;June 20, 2018, the Company issued a Senior Secured Convertible Promissory Note (the &amp;#8220;Convertible Note&amp;#8221;) with a principal&#13;balance of $4.75 million and a maturity date of June 20, 2019. The Convertible Note provided for monthly payments of interest&#13;only at 8.0% per annum, and was collateralized by certain equipment, general intangibles, inventory, and a security interest in&#13;all of the Company&amp;#8217;s trademarks, copyrights and patents. The Convertible Note was convertible into shares of Common Stock&#13;at a conversion price of $1.89 per share.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
&lt;p style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&lt;b&gt;&lt;i&gt;Common&#13;Stock&lt;/i&gt;&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;On&#13;October 23, 2018, the Company amended its Articles of Incorporation to increase the authorized shares of its Common Stock, with&#13;a par value of $0.001 per share, from 50,000,000 to 100,000,000. Holders of the Company&amp;#8217;s Common Stock are entitled to one&#13;vote for each share.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&lt;b&gt;&lt;i&gt;Preferred&#13;Stock&lt;/i&gt;&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;The&#13;Company is authorized to issue 1,000,000 shares of preferred stock in one or more series, each having a par value of $0.001&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;per&#13;share. The Board of Directors is authorized to establish the voting rights, if any, designations, powers, preferences, special&#13;rights, and any qualifications, limitations and restrictions thereof, applicable to the shares of each series. Through December&#13;31, 2018, the Board of Directors had designated four series of Preferred Stock as discussed below.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&lt;b&gt;&lt;i&gt;Series&#13;A Preferred&lt;/i&gt;&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;The&#13;Board of Directors previously designated 250,000 shares as Series A Preferred stock (&amp;#8220;Series A Preferred&amp;#8221;). Each share&#13;of Series A Preferred was entitled to 500 votes in matters voted on by the common stockholders of the Company. In February 2017,&#13;250,000 shares of Series A Preferred stock were voluntarily rescinded by a director of the Company for no consideration. Accordingly,&#13;no Series A Preferred shares are designated for issuance as of December 31, 2018 and 2017.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&lt;b&gt;&lt;i&gt;Series&#13;B Preferred&amp;#160;&lt;/i&gt;&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;The&#13;Board of Directors previously designated 300,000 shares as Series B Preferred Stock (&amp;#8220;Series B Preferred&amp;#8221;). The Series&#13;B Preferred was non-voting, not eligible for dividends and ranked equal to Common Stock and below Series A Preferred in liquidation.&#13;Each share of Series B Preferred was convertible into eight shares of Common Stock. The Company issued 300,000 shares of Series&#13;B Preferred in 2016 and the holder converted 15,193, 115,573 and 169,234 shares of Series B Preferred into shares of Common Stock&#13;for the years ended December 31, 2018, 2017 and 2016, respectively. Accordingly, no shares of Series B Preferred are outstanding&#13;or designated for future issuance as of December 31, 2018.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&lt;b&gt;&lt;i&gt;Series&#13;C Preferred&amp;#160;&lt;/i&gt;&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;In&#13;September 2018, the Board of Directors designated 7,000 shares as Series C Preferred Stock (&amp;#8220;Series C Preferred&amp;#8221;).&#13;Each share of Series C Preferred converts automatically into 1,000 shares of the Company&amp;#8217;s Common Stock when the Company&#13;files an amendment to its Articles of Incorporation to increase the authorized number of shares of Common Stock to 100,000,000.&#13;Holders of the Series C Preferred were entitled to receive dividends declared to holders of Common Stock on an as converted basis.&#13;In addition, each holder of outstanding Series C Preferred was entitled to vote and had liquidation rights on an as converted&#13;basis with the Company&amp;#8217;s Common Stock. In September 2018, the Company entered into an agreement with two members of the&#13;Board of Directors whereby the directors exchanged an aggregate of 6,900,000 shares of Common Stock owned by them for an aggregate&#13;of 6,900 shares of the Company&amp;#8217;s Series C Preferred. In October 2018, the Company amended its Articles of Incorporation&#13;to increase the authorized number of shares of Common Stock to 100,000,000 and, accordingly, all outstanding shares of Series&#13;C Preferred converted to 6,900,000 shares of Common Stock. As of December 31, 2018, no shares of Series C Preferred are outstanding.&#13;Accordingly, no shares of Series C Preferred are outstanding and none are designated for future issuance as of December 31, 2018.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&lt;b&gt;&lt;i&gt;Series&#13;D Preferred&amp;#160;&lt;/i&gt;&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;In&#13;November 2018, the Board of Directors designated 44 shares as Series D Preferred Stock. As discussed in Note 3, the Series D Preferred&#13;provides for the potential payment of up to $15.0 million contingent upon Morinda achieving certain post-closing milestones. As&#13;of December 31, 2018, the Series D Preferred is classified as a liability since it provides for the issuance of a variable number&#13;of shares of Common Stock if the Company elects to settle in shares rather than pay the cash redemption value. Please refer to&#13;Note 3 for additional information on the consideration issued in the Morinda business combination and the valuation and carrying&#13;value of the Series D Preferred.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&lt;b&gt;&lt;i&gt;Summary&#13;of Preferred Stock Activity&lt;/i&gt;&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;The&#13;Company&amp;#8217;s Series A, Series B and Series C Preferred Stock were classified within stockholders&amp;#8217; equity in the&#13;Company&amp;#8217;s consolidated balance sheets. Presented below is a summary of activity for each equity classified series of&#13;Preferred Stock for the years ended December 31, 2018 and 2017:&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 8pt Times New Roman

 Serif&gt;Represents&#13;    the number of shares of Common Stock issuable based on the conversion ratio of 8 shares of Common Stock for each outstanding&#13;    share of Series B Preferred Stock.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&#13;&lt;/table&gt;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 8pt Times New Roman

 Serif&gt;Represents&#13;    the number of shares of Common Stock issuable based on the conversion ratio of 1,000 shares of Common Stock for each outstanding&#13;    share of Series C Preferred Stock.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&#13;&lt;/table&gt;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 8pt Times New Roman

 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&lt;b&gt;&lt;i&gt;Public&#13;Offerings of Common Stock&lt;/i&gt;&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;In&#13;February 2017, the Company issued approximately 4.9 million shares of Common Stock in an underwritten public offering at $3.50&#13;per share for net proceeds of approximately $15.4 million. In April 2018, the Company completed an underwritten public offering&#13;and issued approximately 2.6 million shares of Common Stock for net proceeds of approximately $3.8 million. In August 2018, the&#13;Company completed an underwritten public offering of 9.2 million shares of Common Stock at $1.28 per share for net proceeds of&#13;approximately $9.7 million. In September 2018, pursuant to an At the Market (&amp;#8220;ATM&amp;#8221;) Offering Agreement with Roth Capital&#13;Partners, LLC, the Company commenced an offering that resulted in the issuance of an aggregate of 8.1 million shares of Common&#13;Stock for net proceeds of approximately $35.8 million. In November 2018, the Company issued approximately 14.8 million shares&#13;of Common Stock in an underwritten public offering at $3.50 per share for net proceeds of approximately $47.8 million. Presented&#13;below is a summary of the shares of Common Stock issued and the net proceeds received for public offerings completed in 2018 (in&#13;thousands):&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;table cellspacing=0 cellpadding=0 style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; width: 100%&gt;&#13;&lt;tr style=vertical-align: bottom; font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times

 Serif&gt;97,641&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=padding-bottom: 3pt; font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
&lt;p style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&lt;b&gt;&lt;i&gt;Stock&#13;Options&lt;/i&gt;&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;On&#13;August 3, 2016, the Company&amp;#8217;s approved and implemented the New Age Beverages Corporation 2016-2017 Long Term Incentive Plan&#13;(the &amp;#8220;LTI Plan&amp;#8221;). The LTI Plan provides for stock options to be granted to employees, directors and consultants at&#13;an exercise price not less than 100% of the fair value of the Company&amp;#8217;s Common Stock on the grant date. The options granted&#13;generally have a maximum term of 10 years from the grant date and are exercisable upon vesting. Option grants generally vest over&#13;a period between one and three years after the grant date of such award. As of December 31, 2018, approximately 0.2 million shares&#13;were available for future grants of stock options, restricted stock and similar instruments under the LTI Plan. The number of&#13;shares reserved for grants is adjusted annually on the first day of January whereby a maximum of 10% of the Company&amp;#8217;s outstanding&#13;shares of Common Stock are available for grant under the LTI Plan. Accordingly, as of January 1, 2019, an additional 4.0 million&#13;shares of Common Stock became available for future grants under the LTI Plan.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;The&#13;following table sets forth the summary of stock option activity under the Company&amp;#8217;s Stock Plans for the years ended December&#13;31, 2018 and 2017 (shares in thousands):&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times

 Serif&gt;As&#13;    of December 31, 2018 and 2017, the aggregate intrinsic value of stock options outstanding was $6.6 million and $0.6 million,&#13;    respectively.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&#13;&lt;/table&gt;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 8pt Times New Roman

 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=text-align: right; font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;0.9&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;%&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&#13;&lt;/table&gt;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;Based&#13;on the assumptions set forth above, the weighted-average grant date fair value per share of employee options during the years&#13;ended December&amp;#160;31, 2018 and 2017 was $4.05 and $1.11, respectively. The BSM model requires various highly subjective assumptions&#13;that represent management&amp;#8217;s best estimates of the fair value of the Company&amp;#8217;s Common Stock, volatility, risk-free&#13;interest rates, expected term, and dividend yield. The expected term represents the weighted-average period that options granted&#13;are expected to be outstanding giving consideration to vesting schedules. Since the Company does not have an extended history&#13;of actual exercises, the Company has estimated the expected term using a simplified method which calculates the expected term&#13;as the average of the time-to-vesting and the contractual life of the awards. The Company has never declared or paid cash dividends&#13;and does not plan to pay cash dividends in the foreseeable future; therefore, the Company used an expected dividend yield of zero.&#13;The risk-free interest rate is based on U.S. Treasury rates in effect during the expected term of the grant. The expected volatility&#13;is based on the historical volatility of the Company&amp;#8217;s Common Stock for the period beginning in August 2016 when its shares&#13;were first publicly traded through the grant date of the respective stock options.&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times

 Serif&gt;1,518&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=padding-bottom: 3pt; font: 8pt Times New Roman

 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&#13;&lt;/table&gt;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 8pt Times New Roman

 Times
 Serif&gt;_________________&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 8pt Times New Roman

 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;table cellpadding=0 style=width: 100%; font: 8pt Times New Roman

 Times
 Serif&gt;(1)&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=padding: 0.75pt; text-align: justify; font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;The&#13;    weighted average fair value was $2.22 per share based on the closing price of the Company&amp;#8217;s Common Stock on the grant&#13;    date.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&#13;&lt;/table&gt;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;table cellpadding=0 style=width: 100%; font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&#13;&lt;tr style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=vertical-align: top; width: 48px; padding-left: 0.25in; font: 8pt Times New Roman

 Times
 Serif&gt;(2)&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=padding: 0.75pt; text-align: justify; font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;The&#13;    weighted average fair value was $2.28 per share based on the closing price of the Company&amp;#8217;s Common Stock on the grant&#13;    date.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&#13;&lt;/table&gt;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;table cellpadding=0 style=width: 100%; font: 8pt Times New Roman

 Serif&gt;(3)&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=padding: 0.75pt; text-align: justify; font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;Unvested&#13;    compensation as of December 31, 2018 will be recognized over a weighted average remaining term of 1.6 years.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&#13;&lt;/table&gt;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;table cellpadding=0 style=width: 100%; font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&#13;&lt;tr style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=vertical-align: top; width: 48px; padding-left: 0.25in; font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;(4)&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=padding: 0.75pt; text-align: justify; font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;The&#13;    intrinsic value at the end of the year was based on the closing price of the Company&amp;#8217;s common stock of $5.20 per share&#13;    on December 31, 2018 and $2.17 per share on December 31, 2017.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&#13;&lt;/table&gt;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;In&#13;connection with the business combination with Morinda, the Company made restricted stock award grants for an aggregate of&#13;1.2 million shares of the Company&amp;#8217;s common stock. No shares will be issued until a vesting event occurs. Due to&#13;Morinda&amp;#8217;s foreign operations, upon vesting the awards will be settled in (i) cash where regulatory requirement prohibit&#13;settlement in shares, (ii) shares of Common Stock, or (iii) a combination of shares and cash at the Company&amp;#8217;s election&#13;for certain awards. The awards that must be settled in cash will be presented as a liability in the Company&amp;#8217;s&#13;consolidated balance sheet as discussed below. Due to the grants that were effective at the end of December 2018, no&#13;compensation was recognized for these awards. The following table sets forth a summary of restricted stock award activity&#13;under related to the Morinda grants as of December 31, 2018 (in thousands):&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman

 Serif&gt;_________________&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;table cellpadding=0 style=width: 100%; font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&#13;&lt;tr style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=vertical-align: top; width: 48px; padding-left: 0.25in; font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;(1)&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=padding: 0.75pt; text-align: justify; font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;Restricted&#13;    stock grants vest if Morinda achieves EBITDA of $20.0 million for the year ending December 31, 2019.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&#13;&lt;/table&gt;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;table cellpadding=0 style=width: 100%; font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&#13;&lt;tr style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=vertical-align: top; width: 48px; padding-left: 0.25in; font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;(2)&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=padding: 0.75pt; text-align: justify; font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;Restricted&#13;    stock grants were provided to certain key employees of Morinda and provide for vesting of 100% of the shares if the employee&#13;    continues to be employed through December 31, 2019.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&#13;&lt;/table&gt;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;table cellpadding=0 style=width: 100%; font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&#13;&lt;tr style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=vertical-align: top; width: 48px; padding-left: 0.25in; font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;(3)&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=padding: 0.75pt; text-align: justify; font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;Restricted&#13;    stock grants vest ratably for one-third of the shares on each anniversary of the grant date.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&#13;&lt;/table&gt;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;table cellpadding=0 style=width: 100%; font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&#13;&lt;tr style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=vertical-align: top; width: 48px; padding-left: 0.25in; font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;(4)&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=padding: 0.75pt; text-align: justify; font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;Awards&#13;    that may only be settled in cash will be classified as liabilities in the Company&amp;#8217;s consolidated balance sheets. Accordingly,&#13;    at the end of each future reporting period this liability will be adjusted based on changes in the fair value of the Company&amp;#8217;s&#13;    Common Stock with a corresponding charge to stock-based compensation expense over the vesting period.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&#13;&lt;/table&gt;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;table cellpadding=0 style=width: 100%; font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&#13;&lt;tr style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=vertical-align: top; width: 48px; padding-left: 0.25in; font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;(5)&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=padding: 0.75pt; text-align: justify; font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;Awards&#13;    that may be settled in cash or shares of the Company&amp;#8217;s Common Stock will be classified as equity in the Company&amp;#8217;s&#13;    consolidated balance sheets. Accordingly, a charge to stock-based compensation expense will be recognized over the vesting&#13;    period.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&#13;&lt;/table&gt;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;table cellpadding=0 style=width: 100%; font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&#13;&lt;tr style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=vertical-align: top; width: 48px; padding-left: 0.25in; font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;(6)&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=padding: 0.75pt; text-align: justify; font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;Unvested&#13;    compensation represents the product of the number of shares granted times the closing price of the Company&amp;#8217;s Common&#13;    Stock of $5.20 per shares as of December 31, 2018. Unvested compensation will be recognized as described above. The impact&#13;    of any forfeitures will be recognized as a reduction of stock-based compensation expense in the period in which employees&#13;    terminate.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&#13;&lt;/table&gt;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;As&#13;of December 31, 2018, the remaining unrecognized costs are expected to be recognized on a straight-line basis over a weighted-average&#13;period of approximately 2.6 years for stock options and 1.6 years for restricted stock awards.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&lt;b&gt;&lt;i&gt;Stock-based&#13;Compensation Expense&lt;/i&gt;&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman

 Times
 Serif; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;Stock-based&#13;compensation expense is included in general and administrative expenses in the accompanying consolidated statements of operations.&#13;The table below summarizes stock-based compensation expense related to stock options and restricted stock awards for the years&#13;ended December 31, 2018 and 2017, and the unrecognized compensation expense as of December 31, 2018 and 2017 (in thousands):&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 8pt Times New Roman

 Serif&gt;7,368&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=padding-bottom: 3pt; font: 8pt Times New Roman

 Serif&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman

 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=padding-bottom: 3pt; font: 8pt Times New Roman

 Serif&gt;$&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=border-bottom: black 1pt double; font: 8pt Times New Roman

 Serif&gt;4,477&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=padding-bottom: 3pt; font: 8pt Times New Roman

 Serif&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&#13;&lt;/table&gt;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&lt;b&gt;&lt;i&gt;Warrants&lt;/i&gt;&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;As&#13;of December 31, 2016, the Company had warrants outstanding for 372,974 shares of Common Stock with an exercise price of $0.40&#13;per share. For the year ended December 31, 2017, these warrants were exercised for proceeds of approximately $150,000. No warrants&#13;were granted for the years ended December 31, 2018 and 2017, and no warrants are outstanding as of December 31, 2018 and 2017.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
&lt;p style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&lt;b&gt;&lt;i&gt;Executive&#13;Deferred Compensation Plan&lt;/i&gt;&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;Morinda&amp;#8217;s&#13;Board of Directors implemented an unfunded executive deferred compensation plan in 2009 for certain executives of Morinda. All&#13;financial performance targets under the plan were achieved as of December 31, 2018, and a long-term liability of $4.1 million&#13;is included in the accompanying consolidated balance sheets. After the executives retire, the deferred compensation obligation&#13;is payable over a period up to 20 years.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&lt;b&gt;&lt;i&gt;401(k)&#13;Plan&lt;/i&gt;&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;Morinda&#13;has a defined contribution employee benefit plan under section 401(k) of the Internal Revenue Code (the &amp;#8220;401(k) Plan&amp;#8221;).&#13;The 401(k) Plan covers all eligible U.S. employees of Morinda who are entitled to participate at the beginning of the first full&#13;quarter following commencement of employment. Morinda matches contributions up to 3% of the participating employee&amp;#8217;s compensation.&#13;Morinda&amp;#8217;s matching contributions vest over four years with 0% vested through the end of the first year of service and 33%&#13;vesting upon completion of each of the next three years of service. Total contributions by Morinda to the 401(k) Plan were insignificant&#13;for the period from December 21, 2018 through December 31, 2018. Effective January 1, 2019, the Company extended the right to&#13;participate in the 401(k) Plan to all of the Company&amp;#8217;s eligible employees.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&lt;b&gt;&lt;i&gt;Foreign&#13;Benefit Plans&lt;/i&gt;&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;Morinda&#13;has an unfunded retirement benefit plan for the Company&amp;#8217;s Japanese branch that entitles substantially all employees in Japan,&#13;other than directors, to retirement payments. Morinda also has an unfunded retirement benefit plan in Indonesia that entitles&#13;all permanent employees to retirement payments.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;Upon&#13;termination of employment, the Morinda employees of the Japanese branch are generally entitled to retirement benefits determined&#13;by reference to basic rates of pay at the time of termination, years of service, and conditions under which the termination occurs.&#13;If the termination is involuntary or caused by retirement at the mandatory retirement age of 65, the employee is entitled to a&#13;greater payment than in the case of voluntary termination. Morinda employees in Indonesia whose service is terminated are generally&#13;entitled to retirement benefits determined by reference to basic rates of pay at the time of termination, years of service and&#13;conditions under which the termination occurs. The unfunded benefit obligation for these defined benefit pension plans was approximately&#13;$3.0 million as of December&amp;#160;31, 2018. Of this amount, approximately $2.9 million is included in other long-term liabilities&#13;in the accompanying consolidated balance sheet as of December 31, 2018.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;Morinda&#13;also makes contributions to employee benefit plans in various other countries in which it operates. Total contributions by Morinda&#13;to foreign employee benefit plans were insignificant for the period from December 21, 2018 through December 31, 2018.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&lt;b&gt;&lt;i&gt;Contingencies&lt;/i&gt;&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;The&#13;Company&amp;#8217;s operations are subject to numerous governmental rules and regulations in each of the countries it does business.&#13;These rules and regulations include a complex array of tax and customs regulations as well as restrictions on product ingredients&#13;and claims, the commissions paid to the Company&amp;#8217;s IPCs, labeling and packaging of products, conducting business as a direct-selling&#13;business, and other facets of manufacturing and selling products. In some instances, the rules and regulations may not be fully&#13;defined under the law or are otherwise unclear in their application. Additionally, laws and regulations can change from time to&#13;time, as can their interpretation by the courts, administrative bodies, and the tax and customs authorities in each country. The&#13;Company actively seeks to be in compliance, in all material respects, with the laws of each of the countries in which it does&#13;business and expects its IPCs to do the same. The Company&amp;#8217;s operations are often subject to review by local country tax&#13;and customs authorities and inquiries from other governmental agencies. No assurance can be given that the Company&amp;#8217;s compliance&#13;with governmental rules and regulations will not be challenged by the authorities or that such challenges will not result in assessments&#13;or required changes in the Company&amp;#8217;s business that could have a material impact on its business, consolidated financial&#13;statements and cash flow.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;The&#13;Company has various non-income tax contingencies in several countries. Such exposure could be material depending upon the ultimate&#13;resolution of each situation. As of December&amp;#160;31, 2018, the Company has recorded a current liability under Accounting Standards&#13;Codification (ASC)&amp;#160;450, &lt;i&gt;Contingencies&lt;/i&gt;, of approximately $0.8 million.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;From&#13;time to time, the Company may be a party to litigation and subject to claims incident to the ordinary course of business. Although&#13;the results of litigation and claims cannot be predicted with certainty, the Company currently believes that the final outcome&#13;of these ordinary course matters will not have a material adverse effect on its business. Regardless of the outcome, litigation&#13;can have an adverse impact on the Company because of defense and settlement costs, diversion of management resources, and other&#13;factors.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&lt;b&gt;&lt;i&gt;Guarantee&#13;Deposits&lt;/i&gt;&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
&lt;p style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;In&#13;March 2015, the Company borrowed $60,000 from a member of management. The note provided for interest at 10% per annum and matured&#13;on March 31, 2020. Payments of interest were required quarterly. This note was repaid in full in February 2017. As discussed in&#13;Note 8, 250,000 shares of Series A Preferred stock were voluntarily rescinded by a director of the Company for no consideration&#13;in February 2017.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
&lt;p style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;Net&#13;loss per share is computed by dividing loss attributable to common stockholders by the weighted average number of common shares&#13;outstanding during the year. The calculation of diluted net loss per share includes dilutive stock options, unvested restricted&#13;stock awards, and other Common Stock equivalents computed using the treasury stock method, in order to compute the weighted average&#13;number of shares outstanding. For the years ended December 31, 2018 and 2017, basic and diluted net loss per share were the same&#13;since all Common Stock equivalents were anti-dilutive. As of December 31, 2018 and 2017, the following potential Common Stock&#13;equivalents were excluded from the computation of diluted net loss per share since the impact of inclusion was anti-dilutive (in&#13;thousands):&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;table cellspacing=0 cellpadding=0 style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; width: 100%&gt;&#13;&lt;tr style=vertical-align: bottom; font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman

 Serif&gt;Total&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=border-bottom: black 1pt double; font: 8pt Times New Roman
