 Times
 Serif&gt;5,033&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=padding-bottom: 3pt; font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=border-bottom: black 1pt double; font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=border-bottom: black 1pt double; font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=border-bottom: black 1pt double; font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; text-align: right&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;5,668&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=padding-bottom: 3pt; font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&#13;&lt;/table&gt;&#13;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
&lt;p style=margin: 0pt; font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&lt;b&gt;&lt;i&gt;Fair&#13;Value Measurements&lt;/i&gt;&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;Fair&#13;value is defined as the price that would be received upon sale of an asset or paid to transfer a liability in an orderly transaction&#13;between market participants on the measurement date. When determining fair value, the Company considers the principal or most&#13;advantageous market in which it transacts and considers assumptions that market participants would use when pricing the asset&#13;or liability. The Company applies the following fair value hierarchy, which prioritizes the inputs used to measure fair value&#13;into three levels and bases the categorization within the hierarchy upon the lowest level of input that is available and significant&#13;to the fair measurement:&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0 0 0 0.25in&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;Level&#13;1&amp;#8212;Quoted prices in active markets for identical assets or liabilities accessible to the reporting entity at the measurement&#13;date&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0 0 0 0.25in&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;Level&#13;2&amp;#8212;Other than quoted prices included in Level 1 that are observable for the asset and liability, either directly or indirectly&#13;through market collaboration, for substantially the full term of the asset or liability&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0 0 0 0.25in&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;Level&#13;3&amp;#8212;Unobservable inputs for the asset or liability used to measure fair value to the extent that observable inputs are not&#13;available, thereby allowing for situations in which there is little, if any market activity for the asset or liability at measurement&#13;date&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;The&#13;fair value of the Company&amp;#8217;s cash and cash equivalents, restricted cash, accounts receivable, accounts payable and accrued&#13;liabilities, payables to former Morinda shareholders, and notes payable approximate their carrying values as of December&amp;#160;31,&#13;2018 and 2017. The contingent consideration obligations incurred in the business combinations with Marley and Morinda are recorded&#13;at estimated fair value as of December&amp;#160;31, 2018 and 2017. In addition, the net assets acquired in the business combinations&#13;discussed in Note 3 were generally recorded at fair market value on the date of closing. The Company did not have any other nonrecurring&#13;assets and liabilities measured at fair value as of December&amp;#160;31, 2018 and 2017.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;The&#13;Company&amp;#8217;s interest rate swap and embedded derivative liability are the only liabilities that have been carried at fair value&#13;on a recurring basis. The Company&amp;#8217;s interest rate swap is recorded at fair market value and has been classified within Level&#13;2 of the fair value hierarchy. The Company&amp;#8217;s embedded derivative liability is recorded at fair market value and has been&#13;classified within Level 3 of the fair value hierarchy. Details of the interest rate swap and the embedded derivative liabilities,&#13;including valuation methodology and key assumptions and estimates used, are disclosed in Note 7. The Company&amp;#8217;s policy is&#13;to recognize asset or liability transfers among Level 1, Level 2 and Level 3 as of the actual date of the events or change in&#13;circumstances that caused the transfer. During the years ended December&amp;#160;31, 2018 and 2017, the Company had no transfers of&#13;its assets or liabilities between levels of the fair value hierarchy.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&lt;b&gt;&lt;i&gt;Significant&#13;Concentrations&lt;/i&gt;&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;For&#13;the years ended December 31, 2018 and 2017, one customer comprised approximately 11% and 10%, respectively, of the Company&amp;#8217;s&#13;consolidated net revenue. A substantial portion of the business acquired from Morinda is conducted in foreign markets, exposing&#13;the Company to the risks of trade or foreign exchange restrictions, increased tariffs, foreign currency fluctuations and similar&#13;risks associated with foreign operations. Approximately 70% of the Company&amp;#8217;s consolidated net revenue and 90% of Morinda&amp;#8217;s&#13;net revenue for 2019 is expected to be generated outside the United States, primarily in the Asia Pacific market. Morinda&amp;#8217;s&#13;Tahitian Noni&amp;#174; Juice, MAX and other noni-based beverage products are expected to comprise over 85% of Morinda&amp;#8217;s net&#13;revenue for 2019. However, if consumer demand for these products decreases significantly or if the Company ceases to offer these&#13;products without a suitable replacement, the Company&amp;#8217;s consolidated financial condition and operating results would be adversely&#13;affected. The Company purchases fruit and other Noni-based raw materials from French Polynesia, but these purchases of materials&#13;are from a wide variety of individual suppliers with no single supplier accounting for more than 10% of its raw material purchases&#13;during 2018. However, as the majority of the raw materials are consolidated and processed at the Company&amp;#8217;s plant in Tahiti,&#13;the Company could be negatively affected by certain governmental actions or natural disasters if they occurred in that region&#13;of the world.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;Financial&#13;instruments that subject the Company to concentrations of credit risk consist primarily of cash, cash equivalents, restricted&#13;cash, and accounts receivable. The Company maintains its cash, cash equivalents and restricted cash at high-quality financial&#13;institutions. Cash deposits, including those held in foreign branches of global banks often exceed the amount of insurance,&#13;if any provided on such deposits. As of December 31, 2018, the Company had cash and cash equivalents with a single financial&#13;institution in the United States with a balance of $6.5 million, and two financial institutions in China with balances of&#13;$14.5 million and $8.0 million. The Company also had $3.2 million of restricted cash in China as of December 31, 2018. The&#13;Company has never experienced any losses related to its investments in cash, cash equivalents and restricted cash.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;Generally,&#13;credit risk with respect to accounts receivable is diversified due to the number of entities comprising the Company&amp;#8217;s customer&#13;base and their dispersion across different geographies and industries. The Company performs ongoing credit evaluations on certain&#13;customers and generally does not require collateral on accounts receivable. The Company maintains reserves for potential bad debts&#13;and historically such losses have been insignificant. As of December 31, 2017, one customer comprised approximately 11% of accounts&#13;receivable, net.&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=margin: 0pt; font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
&lt;p style=margin: 0pt; font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 8pt/normal Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; background-color: white&gt;&lt;b&gt;&lt;i&gt;Loan Agreement&lt;/i&gt;&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 8pt/normal Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 12pt 0 0; background-color: white&gt;On March 29, 2019, the Company&#13;entered into a Loan and Security Agreement (the &amp;#8220;Loan Agreement&amp;#8221;) with East West Bank (&amp;#8220;EWB&amp;#8221;).&amp;#160; The&#13;Loan Agreement matures on March 29, 2023 and provides for (i) a term loan in the aggregate principal amount of $15.0 million, which&#13;may be increase to $25.0 subject to the satisfaction of certain conditions (the &amp;#8220;Term Loan&amp;#8221;) and (ii) a $10.0 million&#13;revolving loan facility (the &amp;#8220;Revolving Loan Facility&amp;#8221;). At the closing, EWB funded $25.0 million to the Company consisting&#13;of the $15.0 million Term Loan and $10.0 as an advance under the Revolving Loan Facility. &lt;font style=background-color: white&gt;The&#13;obligations of the Company under the Loan Agreement are secured by substantially all assets of the Company and guaranteed by certain&#13;subsidiaries of the Company&lt;/font&gt;. The Loan Agreement requires compliance with certain financial and restrictive covenants and&#13;includes customary events of default. Key financial covenants include maintenance of minimum Adjusted EBITDA and a maximum Total&#13;Leverage Ratio (all as defined and set forth in the Loan Agreement). During any periods when an event of default occurs, the Loan&#13;Agreement provides for interest at a rate that is 3.0% above the rate otherwise applicable to such obligations.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 8pt/normal Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 12pt 0 0; background-color: white&gt;Borrowings outstanding under&#13;the Loan Agreement bear interest at the Prime Rate plus 0.25%. However, if the Total Leverage Ratio (as defined in the Loan Agreement)&#13;is equal to or greater than 1.50 to 1.00, borrowings will bear interest at the Prime Rate plus 0.50%. The Company may voluntarily&#13;prepay amounts outstanding under the Revolving Loan Facility on ten business days&amp;#8217; prior notice to EWB without prepayment&#13;charges. In the event the Revolving Loan Facility is terminated prior to its maturity, the Company would be required to pay an&#13;early termination fee in the amount of 0.50% of the revolving line. Additional borrowing requests under the Revolving Loan Facility&#13;are subject to various customary conditions precedent, including satisfaction of a borrowing base test as more fully described&#13;in the Loan Agreement. The Revolving Loan Facility also provides for an unused line fee equal to 0.5% per annum of the undrawn&#13;portion. The Loan Agreement includes a lockbox arrangement where the Company is required to direct its customers to remit payments&#13;to a restricted bank account, whereby all available funds are used to pay down the outstanding principal balance under the Revolving&#13;Loan Facility.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 8pt/normal Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 12pt 0 0; background-color: white&gt;Payments under the Term Loan&#13;are interest-only for the first six months and are followed by principal and interest payments amortized over the remaining term&#13;of the Term Loan. The Company may elect to prepay the Term Loan before its maturity on 10 business days&amp;#8217; notice to EWB subject&#13;to a prepayment fee of 2% for the first year of the Term Loan and 1% for the second year of the Term Loan.&amp;#160; No later than&#13;120 days after the end of each fiscal year, commencing with the fiscal year ending December 31, 2019, the Company is required to&#13;make a payment towards the outstanding principal amount of the Term Loan in an amount equal to 35% of the Excess Cash Flow (as&#13;defined in the Loan Agreement), if the Total Leverage Ratio is less than 1.50 to 1.00 or (i) 50% of the Excess Cash Flow if the&#13;Total Leverage Ratio is greater than or equal to 1.50 to 1.00.&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 8pt/normal Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 8pt/normal Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0&gt;Also on March 29, 2019, the Company repaid all outstanding&#13;amounts and terminated the Siena Revolver discussed in Note 7, whereby a prepayment fee of $0.5 million was incurred.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 8pt/normal Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 12pt 0 0; background-color: white&gt;&lt;b&gt;&lt;i&gt;Sale Leaseback&lt;/i&gt;&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 8pt/normal Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 12pt 0 0; background-color: white&gt;On March 22, 2019, the Company&#13;entered into an agreement with a major Japanese real estate company resulting in the sale for approximately $55 million of the&#13;land and building in Tokyo that serves as the corporate headquarters of Morinda&amp;#8217;s Japanese subsidiary. Concurrently with&#13;the sale, the Company entered into a lease of this property for an initial noncancelable term of seven years, with an option at&#13;the Company&amp;#8217;s discretion to extend the lease term for 20 additional years. The monthly lease cost is &amp;#165;20 million (approximately&#13;$181,000 as of March 22, 2019) for the initial seven-year term.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 8pt/normal Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 12pt 0 0; background-color: white&gt;In connection with this transaction,&#13;the Company repaid the $2.9 million mortgage on the building discussed in Note 7, cancelled the related interest rate swap agreement&#13;discussed in Note 7, and is obligated to pay $25.0 million to the former stockholders of Morinda to eliminate the contingent financing&#13;liability discussed in Note 3. After these payments, income taxes, post-closing repair obligations, and transaction costs, the&#13;net proceeds from the sale leaseback are expected to be between $9.0 million and $12.0 million.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 8pt/normal Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 12pt 0 0; background-color: white&gt;The net carrying value of&#13;this property was approximately $29.0 million, resulting in a gain of approximately $26.0 million. The Company is evaluating whether&#13;this transaction qualifies as a sale under ASU 2016-02 (&amp;#8220;&lt;i&gt;Leases&amp;#8221;&lt;/i&gt;). Depending on the final results of this evaluation,&#13;the gain on sale will either be (i) amortized as a reduction of future lease expense over the initial  noncancelable term,&#13;or (ii) recognized in the Company&amp;#8217;s consolidated statement of operations for the quarter ended March 31, 2019. The Company&#13;has not yet determined the amount of ROU lease asset and the corresponding ROU lease liability that will be recognized during the&#13;first quarter of 2019.&lt;b&gt;&lt;i&gt;&lt;/i&gt;&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 8pt/normal Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 12pt 0 0; background-color: white&gt;&lt;b&gt;&lt;i&gt;Other Transactions&lt;/i&gt;&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 8pt/normal Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 12pt 0 0; background-color: white&gt;&lt;b&gt;&lt;i&gt;&lt;/i&gt;&lt;/b&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=margin: 0pt; font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 8pt/107% Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0 0 8pt&gt;On January 14, 2019, the Company entered into an agreement&#13;with Docklight LLC for the exclusive licensing rights in the United States for the manufacturing, sale, distribution, marketing&#13;and advertising of certain products which include shelf-stable, ready to drink, non-alcoholic, consumer beverages infused with&#13;Cannabidiol derived from hemp-based or synthetic sources. The licensed property includes the name, image, likeness, caricature,&#13;signature and biography of Bob Marley, the trademarks MARLEY and BOB MARLEY for use in connection with the Company&amp;#8217;s existing&#13;licensed marks. The initial term of the Agreement expires in January 2024, unless extended or earlier terminated as provided in&#13;the agreement. As consideration for the license, the Company agreed to pay a fee equal to fifty percent of the gross margin, as&#13;defined in the Agreement, on future sales of approved licensed products, which fee shall be reviewed annually by the parties.&#13;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;On&#13;January 21, 2019, the Company entered into a lease for approximately 79,600 square feet of office space in the downtown area of&#13;Denver, Colorado. The monthly obligation for base rent will average approximately $33,000 per month over the lease term which&#13;expires in December 2029. The Company has options to terminate the lease after 90 months as well as the option to extend the lease&#13;for an additional period of five years.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;On&#13;March 12, 2019, the Company granted restricted stock awards to members of the Board of Directors for an aggregate of 90,910 shares&#13;of Common Stock.&amp;#160;The fair value of these shares was $0.5 million based on the closing price of the Company&amp;#8217;s Common&#13;Stock on the grant date. Compensation expense will be recognized until the restricted stock awards vest on March 12, 2020.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;During&#13;the first quarter of 2019, the Company entered into operating lease obligations for transportation equipment. These leases&#13;provide for fixed minimum payments of approximately $17,000 per month over the eight-year lease term for an aggregate&#13;commitment of $1.7 million. The present value of these obligations of $1.3 million will be recorded as an ROU lease asset and&#13;ROU lease liability for the first quarter of 2019.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=margin: 0pt; font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
&lt;p style=font: 8pt/normal Times New Roman
 Times
&lt;p style=font: 8pt/normal Times New Roman
 Times
&lt;p style=font: 8pt/normal Times New Roman
 Times
&lt;p style=font: 8pt/normal Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0&gt;The Company records a provision for doubtful accounts&#13;based on historical experience and a detailed assessment of the collectability of its accounts receivable. In estimating the&#13;allowance for doubtful accounts, the Company considers, among other factors, the aging of the accounts receivable, its&#13;historical write-offs, the credit worthiness of customers, and general economic conditions. Account balances are charged&#13;against the allowance when the Company believes that it is probable that the receivable will not be recovered. Actual&#13;write-offs may either be in excess or less than the estimated allowance. Recoveries of any accounts receivable previously&#13;written off are recorded as a reduction of expense  when received.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 8pt/normal Times New Roman
 Times
&lt;p style=font: 8pt/normal Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0&gt;Inventories consist of the costs associated with the purchase&#13;of raw materials and the manufacturing and transportation of products. Inventories are stated at the lower of cost or net realizable&#13;value using the first-in, first-out method. Provisions for excess inventory are included in cost of goods sold and have historically&#13;been immaterial.&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 8pt/normal Times New Roman
 Times
&lt;p style=font: 8pt/normal Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0&gt;Property and equipment are recorded at cost less accumulated&#13;depreciation and amortization. Depreciation is calculated using the straight-line method over the estimated useful lives of the&#13;assets, as follows:&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 8pt/normal Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;table cellspacing=0 cellpadding=0 style=font: 11pt Calibri
 Helvetica
 Sans-Serif; width: 100%&gt;&#13;&lt;tr style=vertical-align: bottom&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=width: 88%; line-height: 107%&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=width: 12%; border-bottom: black 1pt solid; text-align: center; line-height: 107%&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&lt;b&gt;Years&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&#13;&lt;tr&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=line-height: 107%&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;Buildings and improvements&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=vertical-align: bottom; text-align: center; line-height: 107%&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;28-40&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&#13;&lt;tr&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=line-height: 107%&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;Machinery and equipment&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=vertical-align: bottom; text-align: center; line-height: 107%&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;3-7&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&#13;&lt;tr&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=line-height: 107%&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;Office furniture and equipment&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=vertical-align: bottom; text-align: center; line-height: 107%&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;3-10&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&#13;&lt;tr&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=line-height: 107%&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;Delivery vehicles&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=vertical-align: bottom; text-align: center; line-height: 107%&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;3-5&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&#13;&lt;/table&gt;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 8pt/normal Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 8pt/normal Times New Roman
 Times
&lt;p style=font: 8pt/normal Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;Goodwill represents the excess of the&#13;purchase price of acquired businesses over the estimated fair value of the identifiable net assets acquired. Goodwill and other&#13;intangibles with indefinite useful lives are not amortized but tested for impairment annually or more frequently when events or&#13;circumstances indicates that the carrying value of a reporting unit more likely than not exceeds its fair value. The goodwill impairment&#13;test is applied by performing a qualitative assessment before calculating the fair value of the reporting unit. If, on the basis&#13;of qualitative factors, it is considered more likely than not that the fair value of the reporting unit is greater than the carrying&#13;amount, further testing of goodwill for impairment is not required. If the carrying amount of a reporting unit exceeds the reporting&#13;unit&amp;#8217;s fair value, an impairment loss is recognized in an amount equal to that excess, limited to the total amount of goodwill&#13;allocated to that reporting unit. The Company performed a qualitative assessment and determined there was no impairment of goodwill&#13;for the years ended December 31, 2018 and 2017.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 8pt/normal Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 8pt/normal Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;Intangible assets acquired in business&#13;combinations are recorded at the estimated acquisition date fair value. Finite lived intangible assets are amortized over the shorter&#13;of the contractual life or their estimated useful life using the straight-line method, which is determined by identifying the period&#13;over which the cash flows from the asset are expected to be generated.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 8pt/normal Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 8pt/normal Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;In connection with the Company&amp;#8217;s&#13;business combinations, identifiable intangible assets were acquired that were recorded at estimated fair value on the date of acquisition.&#13;These assets are being amortized using the straight-line method over the amortization periods shown below:&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 8pt/normal Times New Roman
 Times

 Times
 Serif&gt;Non-compete agreements&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=line-height: 107%&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=line-height: 107%&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=text-align: right; line-height: 107%&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times

 Serif; margin: 0&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;table cellpadding=0 style=font: 11pt Calibri
 Helvetica
 Sans-Serif; width: 100%&gt;&#13;&lt;tr&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=vertical-align: top; width: 48px; padding-left: 0.25in; line-height: 107%&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;(1)&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=padding-top: 0.75pt; padding-right: 0.75pt; padding-left: 0.75pt; text-align: justify; line-height: 107%&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
&lt;p style=font: 8pt/normal Times New Roman
 Times
&lt;p style=font: 8pt/normal Times New Roman
 Times
&lt;p style=font: 8pt/normal Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0&gt;&lt;b&gt;&lt;i&gt;Revenue Recognition&lt;/i&gt;&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 8pt/normal Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 8pt/107% Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0 0 8pt&gt;We recognize revenue when our performance obligations&#13;are satisfied. Our primary performance obligation (the distribution and sale of beverage products) is satisfied upon the shipment&#13;or delivery of products to our customers, which is also when control is transferred. Merchandising activities that are performed&#13;after a customer obtains control of the product, are accounted for as fulfillment of our performance obligation to ship or deliver&#13;product to our customers and are recorded in selling, general and administrative expenses. Merchandising activities are immaterial&#13;in the context of our contracts.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 8pt/107% Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0 0 8pt&gt;The transfer of control of products to our customers is&#13;typically based on written sales terms that do not allow for a right of return. However, our policy for DSD and certain chilled&#13;products is to remove and replace damaged and out-of-date products from store shelves to ensure that consumers receive the product&#13;quality and freshness they expect. Similarly, our policy for certain warehouse-distributed products is to replace damaged and out-of-date&#13;products. As a result, we record reserves, based on estimates, for anticipated damaged and out-of-date products.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&lt;b&gt;&lt;i&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/i&gt;&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/font&gt;Revenue&#13;consists of the gross sales price, less estimated returns and allowances for which provisions are made at the time of sale, and&#13;less certain other discounts, allowances, and personal rebates that are accounted for as a reduction from gross revenue. Shipping&#13;and handling charges that are billed to customers are included as a component of revenue. Costs incurred by the Company for shipping&#13;and handling charges are included in cost of goods sold.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
&lt;p style=font: 8pt/normal Times New Roman
 Times
&lt;p style=font: 8pt/normal Times New Roman
 Times
&lt;p style=font: 8pt/normal Times New Roman
 Times
&lt;p style=font: 8pt/normal Times New Roman
 Times
&lt;p style=font: 8pt/normal Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0&gt;The Company holds a derivative financial instrument in the&#13;form of an interest rate swap. The Company uses interest rate swaps to economically convert variable interest rate debt on a foreign&#13;mortgage to a fixed rate. The Company has not designated these derivatives as hedging instruments. The interest rate swaps are&#13;recorded in the accompanying consolidated financial statements at their fair value with the unrealized gains and losses recorded&#13;in interest expense.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 8pt/normal Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 8pt/normal Times New Roman
 Times
&lt;p style=font: 8pt/normal Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0&gt;The Company accounts for income taxes under the asset and&#13;liability method. Under this method, deferred income tax assets and liabilities are determined based on differences between financial&#13;reporting and tax bases of assets and liabilities and are measured using enacted tax rates and laws that are expected to be in&#13;effect when the differences are expected to be recovered or settled. Realization of deferred income tax assets is dependent upon&#13;future taxable income. A valuation allowance is recognized if it is more likely than not that some portion or all of a deferred&#13;income tax asset will not be realized based on the weight of available evidence, including expected future earnings.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 8pt/normal Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 8pt/normal Times New Roman
 Times
&lt;p style=font: 8pt/normal Times New Roman
 Times
&lt;p style=font: 8pt/normal Times New Roman
 Times
&lt;p style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&lt;i&gt;Recently&#13;Adopted Standards.&lt;/i&gt; The following recently issued accounting standards were adopted during fiscal year 2018:&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0 0 0 0.25in&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0 0 0 0.25in&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;In&#13;May 2014, the FASB issued ASU No.&amp;#160;2014-09, &lt;i&gt;Revenue from Contracts with Customers&lt;/i&gt;, which supersedes nearly&#13;all existing revenue recognition standards under U.S. GAAP. The new standard provides a five-step process for recognizing&#13;revenue that depicts the transfer of promised goods or services to customers in an amount that reflects the consideration to&#13;which the entity expects to be entitled in exchange for those goods or services. The Company adopted this ASU using the&#13;full retrospective method effective January 1, 2018. The impact of adoption of this ASU was immaterial and, accordingly,&#13;there were no changes to the previously issued financial statements for the year ended Decemebr 31, 2017.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0 0 0 0.25in&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0 0 0 0.25in&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;In&#13;August 2016, the Financial Accounting Standards Board (&amp;#8220;FASB&amp;#8221;) issued Accounting Standards Update (&amp;#8220;ASU&amp;#8221;)&#13;No. 2016-15, &lt;i&gt;Statement of Cash Flows, Classification of Certain Cash Receipts and Cash Payments.&amp;#160;&lt;/i&gt;The new standard&#13;is intended to reduce diversity in practice in how certain cash receipts and cash payments are classified in the statements of&#13;cash flows and must be adopted retrospectively for each prior reporting period presented upon initial adoption. ASU 2016-15 was&#13;adopted effective January 1, 2018 and did not have a material impact on the Company&amp;#8217;s consolidated financial statements&#13;for the years ended December 31, 2018 and 2017. Accordingly, there were no transactions that required retrospective adjustments&#13;in the consolidated statements of cash flows for the year ended December 31, 2017.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0 0 0 0.25in&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;In&#13;November 2016, the FASB issued ASU No. 2016-18,&amp;#160;&lt;i&gt;Statement of Cash&amp;#160;Flows &amp;#8211; Restricted Cash&lt;/i&gt;, which requires&#13;entities that have restricted cash or restricted cash equivalents to reconcile the change during the period in the total cash,&#13;cash equivalents, and amounts generally described as restricted cash or restricted cash equivalents in its statement of cash flows.&#13;As a result, amounts generally described as cash and restricted cash equivalents should be included with cash and cash equivalents&#13;shown on the statement of cash flows. The Company adopted this standard during 2018 using the retrospective transition method.&#13;The adoption did not result in any changes to the Company&amp;#8217;s previously reported consolidated statements of cash flows for&#13;the year ended December 31, 2017.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0 0 0 0.25in&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0 0 0 0.25in&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;In&#13;May 2017, the FASB issued ASU No. 2017-09,&amp;#160;&lt;i&gt;Compensation&amp;#8212;Stock Compensation: Scope of Modification Accounting&lt;/i&gt;,&#13;which provides clarification on when modification accounting should be used for changes to the terms or conditions of a share-based&#13;payment award. This standard does not change the accounting for modifications of share-based payment awards but clarifies that&#13;modification accounting guidance should only be applied if there is a change to the value, vesting conditions, or award classification&#13;and would not be required if the changes are considered non-substantive. This standard was adopted by the Company in the first&#13;quarter of fiscal 2018 and did not have a material impact on its consolidated financial statements.&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&lt;i&gt;Standards&#13;Required to be Adopted in Future Years.&lt;/i&gt; The following accounting standards are not yet effective; management has not completed&#13;its evaluation to determine the impact that adoption of these standards will have on the Company&amp;#8217;s consolidated financial&#13;statements.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0 0 0 0.25in&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0 0 0 0.25in&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;In&#13;June 2016, the FASB issued ASU 2016-13, &lt;i&gt;Financial Instruments - Credit Losses (Topic 326): Measurement of Credit Losses on&#13;Financial Instruments.&lt;/i&gt;&amp;#160; ASU 2016-13 amends the guidance on the impairment of financial instruments. &amp;#160;This update&#13;adds an impairment model (known as the current expected credit losses model) that is based on expected losses rather than incurred&#13;losses. &amp;#160;Under the new guidance, an entity recognizes, as an allowance, its estimate of expected credit losses. &amp;#160;In&#13;November 2018, ASU 2016-13 was amended by ASU 2018-19, &lt;i&gt;Codification Improvements to Topic 326, Financial Instruments&#13;&amp;#8211; Credit Losses.&lt;/i&gt; &amp;#160;ASU 2018-19 changes the effective date of the credit loss standards (ASU 2016-13) to fiscal&#13;years beginning after December 15, 2021, including interim periods within those fiscal years. Further, the ASU clarifies that&#13;operating lease receivables are not within the scope of ASC 326-20 and should instead be accounted for under the new leasing standard,&#13;ASC 842.&amp;#160; &amp;#160;The Company has not yet determined the effect that ASU 2018-19 will have on its results operations, balance&#13;sheets or financial statement disclosures.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0 0 0 0.25in&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;In&#13;January 2017, the FASB issued ASU No. 2017-04, &lt;i&gt;Intangibles - Goodwill and Other (Topic 350): Simplifying the Test for Goodwill&#13;Impairment.&lt;/i&gt; The amendments in this ASU simplify the subsequent measurement of goodwill by eliminating Step 2 from the goodwill&#13;impairment test and eliminating the requirement for a reporting unit with a zero or negative carrying amount to perform a qualitative&#13;assessment. Instead, under this ASU, an entity would perform its annual, or interim, goodwill impairment test by comparing the&#13;fair value of a reporting unit with its carrying amount and would recognize an impairment charge for the amount by which the carrying&#13;amount exceeds the reporting unit&amp;#8217;s fair value; however, the loss recognized is not to exceed the total amount of goodwill&#13;allocated to that reporting unit. In addition, income tax effects will be considered, if applicable. This ASU is effective for&#13;fiscal years, and interim periods within those fiscal years, beginning after December 15, 2019. Early adoption is permitted. The&#13;Company is currently evaluating the impact of this ASU on its consolidated financial statements and related disclosures.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
&lt;table cellspacing=0 cellpadding=0 style=font: 11pt Calibri

 Serif&gt;Buildings and improvements&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=vertical-align: bottom; text-align: center; line-height: 107%&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman

 Serif&gt;Office furniture and equipment&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=vertical-align: bottom; text-align: center; line-height: 107%&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman

 Serif&gt;3-10&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&#13;&lt;tr&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=line-height: 107%&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;Delivery vehicles&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=vertical-align: bottom; text-align: center; line-height: 107%&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman

 Serif&gt;&lt;b&gt;&lt;i&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/i&gt;&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 8pt Times New Roman

 Serif&gt;4,477&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=padding-bottom: 3pt; font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
&lt;p style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&lt;b&gt;&lt;i&gt;The&#13;Tax Act&lt;/i&gt;&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;In&#13;December 2017, the U.S. Tax Cuts and Jobs Act of 2017 (&amp;#8220;Tax Act&amp;#8221;) was enacted into law which significantly revises&#13;the Internal Revenue Code of 1986, as amended. The newly enacted federal income tax law, among other things, contains significant&#13;changes to corporate taxation, including a flat corporate tax rate of 21%, limitation of the tax deduction for interest expense&#13;to 30% of adjusted taxable income, limitation of the deduction for newly generated net operating losses to 80% of current year&#13;taxable income and elimination of net operating loss (&amp;#8220;NOL&amp;#8221;) carrybacks, future taxation of certain classes of offshore&#13;earnings regardless of whether they are repatriated, immediate deductions for certain new investments instead of deductions for&#13;depreciation expense over time, and modifying or repealing many business deductions and credits beginning in 2018.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;As&#13;of December&amp;#160;31, 2018, the Company has continued its position to return all foreign earnings to the U.S. parent company and&#13;has recorded deferred tax liabilities of $850,000 for foreign withholding taxes associated with foreign retained earnings and&#13;cross-border payments.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;As&#13;a result of the Tax Act, the corporate tax rate decreased from a top marginal rate of 35% that was effective through December&#13;31, 2017 to a flat rate of 21% effective January 1, 2018. Accordingly, a decrease of $1.4 million in the Company&amp;#8217;s domestic&#13;deferred income tax assets was recognized as of December 31, 2017, and this amount was fully offset by a corresponding decrease&#13;in the valuation allowance.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&lt;b&gt;&lt;i&gt;Morinda&#13;Business Combination&lt;/i&gt;&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;Before&#13;the Company acquired Morinda on December 21, 2018, Morinda&amp;#8217;s net earnings taxed for the U.S. and various state jurisdictions&#13;were payable personally by the shareholders pursuant to an election under Subchapter&amp;#160;S of the Internal Revenue Code. The&#13;Subchapter S election terminated upon closing of the business combination with the Company. Accordingly, the Company recognized&#13;net deferred income tax liabilities of approximately $9.9 million for differences between the income tax basis of the assets and&#13;liabilities and the related balances for financial reporting purposes.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;The&#13;Company is required to pay taxes to the appropriate governmental entities on profits derived from Morinda&amp;#8217;s&#13;international operations, including foreign withholding taxes imposed on the remittance of earnings of Morinda&amp;#8217;s&#13;foreign subsidiaries and withholding taxes imposed on royalty payments. The Company has recorded income tax liabilities for&#13;foreign withholding on distributed earnings. As of December 31, 2018, the Company has no undistributed earnings from foreign&#13;subsidiaries that are indefinitely reinvested. The Company is also responsible for state income taxes and other taxes&#13;assessed at the Company level. The Company&amp;#8217;s provision for income taxes includes such taxes.&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&lt;b&gt;&lt;i&gt;Income&#13;Tax Expense&lt;/i&gt;&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;For&#13;the years ended December 31, 2018 and 2017, loss before income taxes is as follows (in thousands):&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;table cellspacing=0 cellpadding=0 style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; width: 100%&gt;&#13;&lt;tr style=vertical-align: bottom; font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=padding-bottom: 1.5pt; font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td colspan=2 style=border-bottom: black 1pt solid; font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; text-align: center&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&lt;b&gt;2018&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=padding-bottom: 1.5pt; font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=padding-bottom: 1.5pt; font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times

 Serif; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;For&#13;the years ended December 31, 2018 and 2017, the reconciliation between the income tax benefit computed by applying the statutory&#13;U.S. federal income tax rate to the pre-tax loss before income taxes, and total income tax expense recognized in the financial&#13;statements is as follows (in thousands):&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 8pt Times New Roman

 Serif&gt;(9,747&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=padding-bottom: 1.5pt; font: 8pt Times New Roman

 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;Net&#13;    deferred income tax liability&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=padding-bottom: 3pt; font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=border-bottom: black 1pt double; font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;$&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=border-bottom: black 1pt double; font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; text-align: right&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;(839&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=padding-bottom: 3pt; font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;)&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=padding-bottom: 3pt; font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=border-bottom: black 1pt double; font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;$&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=border-bottom: black 1pt double; font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; text-align: right&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;-&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=padding-bottom: 3pt; font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&#13;&lt;/table&gt;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0&gt;For the year ended December&amp;#160;31, 2017 the valuation allowance&#13;increased by $0.7 million, primarily as a result of the increase in net operating losses. For the year ended December&amp;#160;31,&#13;2018, the net decrease in the valuation allowance amounted to $2.9 million since net operating loss carryforwards were considered&#13;to be realizable due to net deferred tax liabilities related to purchase accounting. In assessing the realizability of deferred&#13;income tax assets, management considers whether it is more likely than not that some portion or all of the deferred income tax&#13;assets will not be realized.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&lt;b&gt;&lt;i&gt;NOL&#13;Carryforwards and Other Matters&lt;/i&gt;&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;At&#13;December 31, 2018, the Company has federal NOL carryforwards of approximately $36.3 million, of which $24.9 million does not expire&#13;and $11.4 million will begin to expire in 2023. Additionally, the Company has varying amounts of NOL carryforwards in the U.S.&#13;states in which it does business that start to expire in 2023. Federal and state laws impose substantial restrictions on the utilization&#13;of NOL and tax credit carryforwards in the event of an ownership change for income tax purposes, as defined in Section&amp;#160;382&#13;of the Internal Revenue Code.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;Pursuant&#13;to Internal Revenue Code (&amp;#8220;IRC&amp;#8221;) Section 382, annual use of the Company&amp;#8217;s net operating loss carryforwards may&#13;be limited in the event a cumulative change in ownership of more than 50% occurs within a three-year period. The Company has not&#13;completed an IRC Section 382 analysis regarding the limitation of net operating loss carryforwards. The Company&amp;#8217;s ability&#13;to use its remaining net operating loss carryforwards may be further limited if the Company experiences a Section 382 ownership&#13;change in connection with future changes in the Company&amp;#8217;s stock ownership.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;As&#13;discussed above, the imposition of the one-time Transition Tax may reduce or eliminate U.S. federal deferred income taxes on the&#13;unremitted earnings of the Company&amp;#8217;s foreign subsidiaries. However, the Company may still be liable for withholding taxes&#13;or other income taxes that might be incurred upon the repatriation of foreign earnings. The Company has made a provision for additional&#13;income taxes on undistributed earnings of its foreign subsidiaries because the Company does not intend to permanently reinvest&#13;these earnings outside the United States.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;The&#13;Company files income tax returns in the U.S. federal, and various states as well as the following foreign jurisdictions: Australia,&#13;Austria, Canada, Chile, China, Colombia, Germany, Hong Kong, Hungary, Indonesia, Italy, Japan, Korea, Malaysia, Mexico, New Zealand,&#13;Norway, Peru, Poland, Russia, Singapore, Sweden, Switzerland, Thailand, Tahiti, Taiwan, the UK and Vietnam. The Company&amp;#8217;s&#13;federal and state tax years for 2015 and forward are subject to examination by taxing authorities, due to unutilized NOL&amp;#8217;s.&#13;All foreign jurisdictions tax years are also subject to examination based on the relative statute of limitations.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times

&lt;p style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;The&#13;Company&amp;#8217;s chief operating decision maker (the &amp;#8220;CODM&amp;#8221;), who is the Company&amp;#8217;s Chief Executive Officer,&#13;allocates resources and assesses performance based on financial information of the Company. The CODM reviews financial&#13;information presented for  each reporting segments for purposes of making operating decisions and assessing financial&#13;performance. Accordingly, the Company operates in two reportable segments as presented in Note 15.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
&lt;table cellspacing=0 cellpadding=0 style=font: 8pt Times New Roman

&lt;p style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0&gt;&lt;b&gt;&lt;i&gt;Reportable Segments&lt;/i&gt;&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0&gt;The Company follows segment reporting in accordance with ASC&#13;Topic 280, &lt;i&gt;Segment Reporting&lt;/i&gt;. As a result of the business combination with Morinda in December 2018 as discussed in&#13;Note 3, the Company has changed its operating segments to consist of the Morinda segment and the New Age segment. The New Age&#13;segment was previously comprised of the Brands segment and the DSD segment which are now combined as a single segment as they&#13;are operating with a single management team. After the Morinda business combination, the Company&amp;#8217;s CODM began&#13;assessing performance and allocating resources based on the financial information of these two reporting segments.&#13;Accordingly, the Company&amp;#8217;s previous segment disclosures have been restated for the year ended December 31, 2017.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0&gt;The New Age segment  distributes beverages to retail customers&#13;throughout Colorado and surrounding states, and sells beverages to wholesale distributors, broad-liners, key account owned warehouses&#13;and international accounts using several distribution channels. Morinda is a healthy lifestyles and beverage company with operations&#13;in more than 60 countries around the world, and manufacturing operations in Tahiti, Germany, Japan, the US, and China. Morinda&#13;is primarily a direct-to-consumer and e-commerce business with over 70% of its business generated in the key Asia Pacific markets&#13;of Japan, China, Korea, Taiwan, and Indonesia.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0&gt;Net revenue by reporting segment for the years ended December 31,&#13;2018 and 2017, is as follows (in thousands):&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times

 Serif&gt;Depreciation&#13;and amortization expense related to property and equipment amounted to $0.7 million and $0.6 million for the years ended December&amp;#160;31,&#13;2018 and 2017, respectively. Repairs and maintenance costs amounted to $0.8 million and $0.7 million for the years ended December&amp;#160;31,&#13;2018 and 2017, respectively.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 8pt Times New Roman

 Serif&gt;Restricted&#13;    cash primarily represents long-term cash deposits held in a bank for a foreign governmental agency. This deposit is required&#13;    to maintain the Company&amp;#8217;s direct selling license to do business in China.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&#13;&lt;/table&gt;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman

 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=border-bottom: black 1pt double; font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;$&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=border-bottom: black 1pt double; font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; text-align: right&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;2,394&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=padding-bottom: 3pt; font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&#13;&lt;/table&gt;&#13;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=margin: 0pt; font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
&lt;p style=font: 8pt/normal Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0&gt;The Company determines if contractual arrangements are considered&#13;a lease at inception. Operating leases are included in operating lease right-of-use (&amp;#8220;ROU&amp;#8221;) assets, whereas assets&#13;related to finance leases are included in property and equipment. The corresponding liabilities related to ROU assets and assets&#13;under financing leases are included in accrued liabilities and other long-term liabilities in the Company&amp;#8217;s consolidated&#13;balance sheets, based on the related contractual maturities. ROU assets represent the Company&amp;#8217;s right to use an underlying&#13;asset for the lease term and lease liabilities represent the related obligations to make lease payments arising from the lease.&#13;Operating lease ROU assets and liabilities are recognized at the lease commencement date based on the present value of lease payments&#13;over the lease term. None of the Company&amp;#8217;s leases provide an implicit interest rate, which requires use of the Company&amp;#8217;s&#13;estimated incremental borrowing rate to determine the present value of lease payments. The operating lease ROU asset also includes&#13;any lease payments made and excludes lease incentives.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 8pt/normal Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 8pt/normal Times New Roman
 Times
&lt;p style=font: 8pt/normal Times New Roman
 Times

var Show={};Show.LastAR=null
Show.showAR=function(a
r
w){if(Show.LastAR)Show.hideAR();var e=a;while(e&&e.nodeName!='TABLE')e=e.nextSibling;if(!e||e.nodeName!='TABLE'){var ref=((window)?w.document:document).getElementById(r);if(ref){e=ref.cloneNode(!0);
e.removeAttribute('id');a.parentNode.appendChild(e)}}
if(e)e.style.display='block';Show.LastAR=e};Show.hideAR=function(){Show.LastAR.style.display='none'};Show.toggleNext=function(a){var e=a;while(e.nodeName!='DIV')e=e.nextSibling;if(!e.style){}else if(!e.style.display){}else{var d
p_;if(e.style.display=='none'){d='block';p='-'}else{d='none';p='+'}
e.style.display=d;if(a.textContent){a.textContent=p+a.textContent.substring(1)}else{a.innerText=p+a.innerText.substring(1)}}}








/* Updated 2009-11-04 */
/* v2.2.0.24 */
/* DefRef Styles */
..report table.authRefData{
	background-color: #def;
	border: 2px solid #2F4497;
	font-size: 1em;
	position: absolute;
}
..report table.authRefData a {
	display: block;
	font-weight: bold;
}
..report table.authRefData p {
	margin-top: 0px;
}
..report table.authRefData .hide {
	background-color: #2F4497;
	padding: 1px 3px 0px 0px;
	text-align: right;
}
..report table.authRefData .hide a:hover {
	background-color: #2F4497;
}
..report table.authRefData .body {
	height: 150px;
	overflow: auto;
	width: 400px;
}
..report table.authRefData table{
	font-size: 1em;
}
/* Report Styles */
..pl a
 .pl a:visited {
	color: black;
	text-decoration: none;
}
/* table */
..report {
	background-color: white;
	border: 2px solid #acf;
	clear: both;
	color: black;
	font: normal 8pt Helvetica
 Arial
 san-serif;
	margin-bottom: 2em;
}
..report hr {
	border: 1px solid #acf;
}
/* Top labels */
..report th {
	background-color: #acf;
	color: black;
	font-weight: bold;
	text-align: center;
}
..report th.void	{
	background-color: transparent;
	color: #000000;
	font: bold 10pt Helvetica
 Arial
 san-serif;
	text-align: left;
}
..report .pl {
	text-align: left;
	vertical-align: top;
	white-space: normal;
	width: 200px;
	white-space: normal; /* word-wrap: break-word; */
}
..report td.pl a.a {
	cursor: pointer;
	display: block;
	width: 200px;
	overflow: hidden;
}
..report td.pl div.a {
	width: 200px;
}
..report td.pl a:hover {
	background-color: #ffc;
}
/* Header rows... */
..report tr.rh {
	background-color: #acf;
	color: black;
	font-weight: bold;
}
/* Calendars... */
..report .rc {
	background-color: #f0f0f0;
}
/* Even rows... */
..report .re
 .report .reu {
	background-color: #def;
}
..report .reu td {
	border-bottom: 1px solid black;
}
/* Odd rows... */
..report .ro
 .report .rou {
	background-color: white;
}
..report .rou td {
	border-bottom: 1px solid black;
}
..report .rou table td
 .report .reu table td {
	border-bottom: 0px solid black;
}
/* styles for footnote marker */
..report .fn {
	white-space: nowrap;
}
/* styles for numeric types */
..report .num
 .report .nump {
	text-align: right;
	white-space: nowrap;
}
..report .nump {
	padding-left: 2em;
}
..report .nump {
	padding: 0px 0.4em 0px 2em;
}
/* styles for text types */
..report .text {
	text-align: left;
	white-space: normal;
}
..report .text .big {
	margin-bottom: 1em;
	width: 17em;
}
..report .text .more {
	display: none;
}
..report .text .note {
	font-style: italic;
	font-weight: bold;
}
..report .text .small {
	width: 10em;
}
..report sup {
	font-style: italic;
}
..report .outerFootnotes {
	font-size: 1em;
}
